routes.description: ROSY (Alternate start), just outside the cave, to the left of a tree. Joins ROSY at the square ledge at 4m. Can be used as an alternative start to any climb between JACKY and KAJ, esp if there are others in the cave. Has the same Ubolts as ROSY. The 3rd Ubolt (just above the roof) could be better than the neighbouring hanger bolt as it may lessen rope drag across a sharp edge at the roof.

routes.name: Mort(al Comeback)
routes.description: Starting up JACKY/DARLING out of the cave, go diagonally R, then follow P bolts up crossing the black waterstreak to anchors.

routes.name: Moaah
routes.description: Mummy in southern Danish dialect. Start out of cave, then go diagonally R crossing the black water streak following Ubolts up the steeper slab to anchors. It is possible to lower back to the small ledge on the R (near arete) and do all the routes on this beautiful hanging face from a 3bolt belay.

routes.name: Kaj
routes.description: Pronounce like eye, sigh, pie, sky or even hi. Not only Danes have strange pronunciation. Can be climbed from the ground starting as for JACKY/DARLING or down from MORT or ROSY to ledge above trees on the arete at a 3bolt anchor. Climb the exposed arete to anchor. Hard start off little ledge

routes.name: Boy
routes.description: Up using the incut footholds and perhaps a rung (for protection only) to the first small Ubolt, to an obvious footrail at 3m. Go L along this to the arete – via several inobvious underclings. Up the arete to a ledge shared with KAJ. Climb the arete as for KAJ. Use the anchors just R of the arête to minimise ropedrag. Easier if you are tall.

routes.name: Kajboy
routes.description: Start left of the bolt ladder to the footrail, as for BOY. Continue up the easy notched arete-let in face. It gets thinner at the top, going up slightly left to a better hold. Could be harder for short climbers.

routes.name: Kat
routes.description: As for KAJBOY to 5th bolt. Continue up straight or slightly R, via a 2cm foothold and R slanting crimp to a hard finish. Will be harder still for shorter climbers

routes.name: Stack
routes.description: to the ledge above the bolt ladder. Not using the tree or ladder may be > 11 (13?). Up to the smaller ledge and stem the gap to gain the arete on the other side of the scramble. Up this noting the inter-locking stacked blocks at top.

routes.name: Freddy
routes.description: Looks like a nightmarish, downward-flaring, overhanging chimney. A happy surprise awaits you. Start at the back of the chimney 6m R of the bolt ladder.  Up and traverse outwards on footrails. Beware loose stones deep in the slot. It may be necessary for the 2nd to follow to clean this route.
routes.fa_text: C Curson G Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Consistency Is Fashion
routes.description: Climb the rightmost arete of the descent gully (marked CIF). Start just left of the arete, crossing to the right. Up to chain anchors. A great route in a brilliant position.

routes.name: Feel Good
routes.description: Start at corner 3m R of C I F. Layback to where the corner opens to a face. Continue to anchors.
routes.fa_text: Brad Davies, Kieran Davies, Hilton Davies

routes.name: Excuse Me While I Kiss The Sky
routes.description: Climb the right of the buttress on/near the arête, starting 3m R of FEEL GOOD.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg, Derk Battjes

routes.name: Group Dynamics
routes.description: Variant to the last route, starting up the corner 2m R of the arete. Perhaps 20/1 for short people

routes.name: Palaver
routes.description: About 8-10m R of the EXCUSE arête is a big corner / chimney. Up tree roots into chimney. Some interesting climbing will see you through to the top.

routes.name: Hyde
routes.description: Good in parts. Start about 3m R of the corner/chimney. Steep up to the midpoint. Climb up R of the bolts on smaller holds. Delicate use of the branch up high will facilitate the direct finish. This has not been done without the tree – the crimps are small!

routes.name: Dr Jekyll And Mr Hyde
routes.description: Start up HYDE to the small ledge/stance. Trend R past a Ubolt between the boltlines and finish up the last few meters of JEKYLL.

routes.name: Jekyll
routes.description: Start just left of IMOJ chimney – 6m R of the mega corner.  Up steeply on mainly good holds then a bit L to gain the slab. Continue up to a 3 Ubolt anchor.

routes.name: I M O Julius
routes.description: Another chimney 7m R of the major corner/chimney. The name came from Gustav’s previous dog – named independently (by someone else!) of the following dog CEASAR. Pull past the fig tree to get into the cleft. Follow this to Ubolt anchors. You can start up JEKYLL missing most of the fig tree at about 16.

routes.name: Darth
routes.description: Not such a pretty face when viewed through the fig tree. But the upper section has great climbing. Negotiate the blocky little corner 2m R of IMOJ thru the fig tree to access this narrow face between 2 chimney lines. Take care with some of the blocks down low.

routes.name: Just Another Pretty Face
routes.description: Start up BRUTUS for 4 Ubolts, stepping left onto DARTHs face just above the fig tree, just below the crux sequence. These are very sweet moves, laybacking right and left.

routes.name: Brutus
routes.description: Climb the chimney, as for CEASAR, but stay outside the cleft, stemming left onto JAPF to avoid moving into the bowels of the earth, where the climb steepens. Up to anchors just left of the cleft.

routes.name: Ceasar
routes.description: Gustav inherited the dog with the name spelt this way. The route climbs the chimney 4m R of IMOJ moving about 3m into the cleft at the steepening to a groove in the left wall. Can now be protected on JAPF for 4 bolts, (or WAWs) then 3 Ubolts inside the chimney. Use anchors above and left of the cleft.

routes.name: Woodchoppers And Waterbearers
routes.description: Climb up the right arete. Avoid using opposite side of chimney. Then move right onto the face after the small roof. Apparently a hold is now missing making the route much harder.

routes.name: Yellow Polka Dot
routes.description: A rather loose few metres (careful) of easy climbing leads to an appealing yellow-dotted headwall. Fun climbing becomes technical higher up.

routes.name: Who’s Line Is It Anyway
routes.description: Starts 8 m left of the Good and Evil arête and diagonally up right. Lead-out but safe. A great climb.

routes.name: Good And Evil
routes.description: [ GPS: S25 40 30.1 E30 22 08.5]  The obvious arête on the big blocky buttress to the left of the highest section of the crag when looking from the farmhouse parking. Stay left of the 5th bolt that was placed out there due to hollow sounding rock on the arete.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg, Voytek Modrzewski

routes.name: Wasp Warriors
routes.description: Climb diagonally right up the middle of the obvious west facing face.

routes.name: Cool Runnings
routes.description: The arête & face left of the prominent crack in the corner.

routes.name: Aapstreke
routes.description: The obvious chimney right of CR.
routes.fa_text: Abert Smit, Sarel Smit, Wikus Spies & Lohan Spies

routes.name: Temple Of Love
routes.description: Follow the path around the corner 25m to the right of the Aapstreke chimney. Climb the small open book and skirt the overlap on the right.

routes.name: Walking On Sunshine
routes.description: Starting at a multi-stemmed tree, climb the curved crack to an aloe. Step left onto the ledge with a block, climb the face following the corner for 15m. Rail out left on face up to an ab tree. Take plenty of  small gear.

routes.name: Nitro's Tick Fever
routes.description: Climbs the slabby wall about 50 m right of the ‘Wasp Warrior’ opened up by a visiting Czech climber.
routes.notes: BB: Neil Margetts. Poorly bolted, very difficult to clip some of the bolts if short.

routes.name: Lost In Translation
routes.description: Starts at the righthand end of the obvious long roof. Keep slightly left on small crimps as you break through the initial overhang and hang on for the great ride to the chains!

routes.name: Atlantis
routes.description: A great line. Pull a small overlap then head into the corner and race for the chains up steeper ground.

routes.name: Eldorado
routes.description: One of the best lines at the crag. A sustained and sequence of technical mastery takes you to the chains. Consensus is easy 28 (7c). Name written on the rock.

routes.name: Inca Trail
routes.description: A slabby looking line on the golden wall between SWAT Team & Eldorado. The line weaves its way through a series of balancy moves.

routes.name: S.w.a.t. Team
routes.description: A lovely intro to this section of the wall. Amazingly comfortable holds and great friction. Rebolted and upgraded from 23. Mantle onto the initial protruding block and head up the water groove. Name written on the rock.

routes.name: Fever
routes.description: Start on a big block and climb a cruxy 4 bolts over a bulge. Continue up the bolt line to the anchors. Low in the grade.

routes.name: Vision Thing
routes.description: Starts 20m right of FEVER. Negotiate a small roof, pull through the cruxy bulge. Switch style and enjoy the face climbing to the chains. Important: To avoid rope drag, unclip the first bolt and use long sling on second draw beneath the roof. 60m rope essential!

routes.name: Peaceful Sleep
routes.description: This route starts at the base of a huge, well established two-stemmed tree. Climb the layback under a small roof, using the finger crack to step up and left onto the ledge. Then onto the face with fun climbing to chains.

routes.name: The Beeman And The Bushman
routes.description: Start up obvious diagonal crack tending right through overlaps.

routes.name: Beat Them Dead
routes.description: Start under a big roof. Head right, then into small open book, following the thin crack to chains.

routes.name: There Is Treasure Everywhere
routes.description: Start 18m left of Malaria at  ??? an undercut base between some trees under the obvious roof crack in the sky. Climb the face up to a small stance under a left-leaning corner. Climb the corner till forced to the arete out right. Climb face till stance under the roof. Traverse left into roof crack and up.

routes.name: Six Dead Mosquitos On My Leg
routes.description: Climb into a small roof, when standing on it, traverse out right and then up to face climbing. BB: Rory & Gary Lowther

routes.name: Malaria
routes.description: 5m right of the previous climb, starting on a slab. Climb out right at the small roof and onto the face for another 20m. BB: Rory Lowther & Chris Rudolph

routes.name: Alex's Mousse Au Chocolat
routes.description: Starts in the back of a little gully, behind a free-standing pillar, left of ROC RALLY.

routes.name: Evelyn
routes.description: Starts halfway up a pillar on a stance. At the third bolt, climb over onto the main wall.

routes.name: Balance Of Power
routes.description: Takes the groove just left of ROC RALLY. Consensus seems to have brought this climb down to 22 from 24 but not a giveaway; Gus moved a bolt so you can no longer chicken out onto Roc Rally!
routes.fa_text: Ed February & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Roc Rally
routes.description: A short route 20m left of FUG.

routes.name: Broken Tree
routes.description: Starts 1 metre to the right of Roc Rally. First bolt right of small tree. Three cruxes, all different and gets airy after the step over. Needs 60 meter rope. Great Photo opportunity from top of crag.

routes.name: Fug
routes.description: New route well indicated on the rock.

routes.name: Beauty Is In The Eye Of The Belayer
routes.description: One bolt on the face takes you through the trees with funky moves onto the face above and to the top of the crag. A 60m rope is just long enough!
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Ed February

routes.name: Endless Blowjob
routes.description: The well-marked climb left of LITTLE BONSAI. High 1st bolt.

routes.name: Little Bonsai
routes.description: Marked. The first route left of the CHIMNEYING TAMMY recess. Classic at the grade.

routes.name: Chimneying Tammy
routes.description: Typical chimney climb to the left of GMGMG. Technical and fun climbing to a ledge above which you can top out on or ab in from chains.

routes.name: Goats Milk Gives Me Gastro
routes.description: Scramble up to the left of Diseased Mad Cow to find the line on the inside arête, just outside the cave. Cruxy start then ont

routes.name: Diseased Mad Cow
routes.description: Start in a corner 12m L of GRUNT. Climb the crack, then onto ledge to traverse out right and through the roof onto the arête and face above, try keep right towards chains.

routes.name: Grunt
routes.description: The obvious roof crack with easier headwall.

routes.name: I Feel Rocks
routes.description: Starts on a pile of rocks 3m left of Biogalactic Gargleblaster. Power through the roof and traverse diagonally up to slabs above.

routes.name: Up Your Tree
routes.description: Shares a start with I Feel Rocks. Use the tree to get onto the overlap. Join up with the final moves on Biogalactic Gargleblaster.

routes.name: Biogalactic Gargleblaster
routes.description: Start 8m right of GRUNT. Dynamic start onto jugs can also be done statically if tall (to cheat: use the tree or traverse from the right). Climb a few meters to a ledge, then some face moves to chains. Awesome photo opportunity of climb, from ledges out right of chains.

routes.name: Caviars Whiskers
routes.description: Start 5m right of the previous climb up the obvious layback crack in the big recess just before the scramble out of the crag. Follow bolts diagonally right.

routes.name: Pit Fighter
routes.description: Direct version of STITCH IT. From the obvious slopey right hand side pull keep going straight up, slightly left on small holds. Leave the chalk bag behind. A power test-piece.

routes.name: Stitch It
routes.description: Halfway down the standard scramble, look left. The route pulls straight up the middle of the face on the leaning free-standing boulder. Move right at the slopey side pull to a jug out right by means of one really hard iron cross, no feet, go and believe move.

routes.name: Rubik's Cube
routes.description: Start on the two obvious crimps do two dynos and a couple of hard moves, nice route. Harder if you use less holds on the arête like the

routes.name: Logger Sports
routes.description: A climb by itself on the walk in. There is a ‘death block’ halfway up which we tried to lever off but did not succeed. Be careful or avoid it.

routes.name: Papsak
routes.description: Anyone have the details for this route? Goes up the arete left of AFTER THOUGHT's corner

routes.name: Loopdop
routes.description: Up middle of face left of AFTER THOUGHT's corner.

routes.name: Afterthought
routes.description: Climbs the corner crack situated 20 metres to the left of the descent gully (when facing the bottom of the gulley).

routes.name: Diablo
routes.description: Climb the bouldery face 5 meters right of AFTERTHOUGHT. Intense start with a interesting finish.

routes.name: A.s
routes.description: Climbs the chimney just right of AFTERTHOUGHT's corner. A grovel but a good lesson in entry level chimney climbing.

routes.name: Open Project:
routes.description: The route ascends the face left of the descent gully. Has been closed for years but now open

routes.name: Arete Project (open)
routes.description: The route ascends the right arete of the descent gulley.
routes.notes: Bolted by Ken Thrash. MCSA bolts

routes.name: Raptophilia
routes.description: Start with your feet on the lowest boulders, preclip first bolt. Enjoy the intricate footwork and desperate stabbing for holds. Finish rightwards to for most fun. Low in grade.

routes.name: Psyche Ward
routes.description: Starts off the boulder. Climb up and pre-clip the 2nd draw. Dead-point your way to the chains.

routes.name: Baboons In Boardshorts
routes.description: As descending the gully, this easy climb is on the left and angles up leftwards on grey slab.
routes.fa_text: Kieren Davies, Brad Davies & Hilton Davies

routes.name: Trench Town
routes.description: Slab on arête in descent gully.

routes.name: Adam
routes.description: Halfway down the descent gully walk left onto a big ledge. Climbs the slanting feature.

routes.name: Irritable Male Syndrome
routes.description: Climb the next slanting feature.

routes.name: One Love
routes.description: Climb the face just right of the cave.

routes.name: Almost Uschi
routes.description: Surprisingly pleasant face left of the GRIZZLY BEHRs crack.

routes.name: Grizzly Behr
routes.description: Climb the cool looking crack for a good distance to main ledge.

routes.name: Just Behrly
routes.description: Can you hold the smallest holds in Boven? Starts up the tree right of Grizzly Bear. Clip 1st bolt then use the tree to gain the good rail up and right. Move left then up to a good hold to clip the second bolt…..now brace your fingers and hang on, just barely.

routes.name: Renewable Energy
routes.description: From the ledge below the open book, head left onto the steep face.

routes.name: Lucky Leila
routes.description: Start up the groove from the blocky ledge behind the tree. Take care clipping the high first bolt. Climb the face followed by a roof.

routes.name: Whait Watcher Pitch One
routes.description: From the ledge below the open book, traverse one move right and up the groove.

routes.name: Whait Watcher Pitch Two
routes.description: Head straight through the overlap into interesting bouldery stuff.

routes.name: Qina
routes.description: Start on top of the large block. Straight up the short steep wall and onto the ledge, continue on to good anchors.

routes.name: No More Dynamo
routes.description: Starts on the large block in the middle of the path. Climb slightly left to start off.

routes.name: Up In Smoke
routes.description: Badly bolted weak effort about 3m left of Goose On The Loose.

routes.name: Slave Species
routes.description: Just right of UP IN SMOKE. Share chains with PRETENDERS.

routes.name: Pretenders
routes.description: Climb the bulging steep wall. Go left to clip bolt 6, finish below main roof.

routes.name: Goose On The Loose
routes.description: Climb first 5 bolts with Pretenders, clip the next 2 bolts and then finish at higher anchors for (harder) direct finish.

routes.name: Up Alard's Crack
routes.description: If you enjoy chimney's, this one is for you. The route is in the obvious corner chimney.

routes.name: Pygmy Party
routes.description: Starts as for KANNIE-BALLISTIC but head straight through the roofs.

routes.name: Kannie-ballistic
routes.description: Start at the base of the chimney that becomes UP ALARD'S CRACK. Follow bolts left and up then step over and continue diagonally right after the steep section. Take long draws for bolts no. 3, 4 and 7 if you want to take out a bit of rope drag.
routes.fa_text: Philippe Gaboriaud and Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Legends
routes.description: Short face climb below the big roof, rails out right a bit after the final bolt. Stays dry in heavy rain.

routes.name: Jamani
routes.description: Fine dihedral with a good crack to below the roof. Stays dry in heavy rain.
routes.fa_text: Mike Cartwright, Chris Dabrowski and Gus Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Sweet Plumb
routes.description: Excellent long face climb to the right of the main roof. Head up the crack toward the surprisingly solid excrement then up left onto the technical face.

routes.name: Sour Grapes
routes.description: Route climbs the face right of Sweet Plum. Climb past the chains of TBTR and goes all the way to the top.

routes.name: Thorn Between The Roses
routes.description: Starts 2m right of Sweet Plumb, just right of the obvious off-width crack and climb the arête.

routes.name: Twice In A Blue Moon:
routes.description: Route climbs the off-width crack between TBTR and WILD FIRE.

routes.name: Wild Fire
routes.description: Starts about 2 metres left of Heroes. Pull through the roof at the bottom and follow the shallow open book to the chains.

routes.name: Heroes
routes.description: Start in a short overhanging corner, climb up this (burly) and up the nice wall above to below the upper roof. Stays dry in heavy rain.

routes.name: Condor
routes.description: A few metres right of Heroes is a right trending line. Impossible if you have the wrong beta for your length. Stays dry in heavy rain. Bolted by Andrew Pedley and Dylan Voigt.

routes.name: The Bovenator
routes.description: Starts by the black streak. A tricky compression start lead to lots and lots of fun. This is your chance to be The Bovenator. Stays dry in heavy rain.

routes.name: Bovenatrix
routes.description: Start on the blocky arête right of Bovenator. Up past some reachy cruxy stuff then with sustained interest up the face to the chains.
routes.notes: Part bolted by Mark Millar, the rest by Greg Borman

routes.name: Dreamers
routes.description: Main recess to major ledge out right, longer route but 60m gets you back. Stays dry in heavy rain.
routes.notes: The extension is partially bolted and is an open project.

routes.name: Hypopnea
routes.description: Weird but a cool outing! From the ledge at the chains of Dreamers (23), un-clip the chains and keep clipping diagonally left, breathing slowly..go way left..then up to the chains. If you do this and Dreamers as one pitch, you need a 70m rope and tie knots in the ends!

routes.name: Not-da-mama
routes.description: 5m right of Dreamers and ends on the same ledge, but has its own chains. To avoid rope drag use a longer draw on the 7th bolt and once clipped into the 9th bolt, unclip the 8th bolt. Stays dry in heavy rain.

routes.name: Hey Mama
routes.description: Starts about 2m to the right of Not-da-Mamma.

routes.name: African Rain
routes.description: Start in between the 2 drips between the routes "Hey Mama" and "Ice Scream Sundae". Follow the thin diagonal crack up to the ledge and continues straight up the head wall.

routes.name: Ice Scream Sundae
routes.description: Up the first 3 bolts of S.T.P. then traverse left to the arete, then up to a ledge. Continue up the left side of the large open book to the roof and up to the chains. NB: a 70 m rope does NOT get you to the ground. Use the lower off's on the ledge. To avoid rope drag unclip the 3rd bolt once you've clipped the 4th. Can also be done in 2 pitches.

routes.name: Sticky Toffee Pudding (s.t.p).
routes.description: A long and varied climb with great exposed arête finale.

routes.name: Sweet Child Of Mine
routes.description: Some exposure and a worrying clip or two, though if you are capable, it’s great fun! Some loose rock on lower section and massive hollow flake at top of the corner. Starts at the base of a steep rightward trending corner amongst the trees. Climb this with effort then moves leftwards to a slab and rest, before tackling a technical and airy arete.

routes.name: Pashash Madala.
routes.description: Two pitches. The first is easy the second is very hard. Best to try the top pitch off a hanging belay (two bolts). Some outrageously thin and techy moves up the short vertical wall. Unrepeated ATOW.

routes.name: Rolihlahla (aka The Overlord).
routes.description: Need confIrmation. Bovens latest cover shot. Yes, it really does cross the big blank face! Gallop up the wall left of Butterfly, to a no hands rest on the left, then across the face with great difficulty. The hard bit is the first 1/3. Opened at 35 downgraded to 32 and now maybe 33 as some footholds got smaller. Take up slings.. and your strongest fingers. Joins Butterfly for the last 2-3 bolts

routes.name: Butterfly Pitch One
routes.description: Great climb to chains below the massive roof. Stunning moves up the corner and through roof, easier than it looks!

routes.name: Butterfly Pitch Two.
routes.description: The crack in the sky! Can abseil in to the ledge, or access by climbing Pitch 1. Great photos from the top of the crag.

routes.name: big Butterfly
routes.description: Ground to top in one giant and stunning pitch. Moves right after chains. Use two ropes (or both ends of same rope) and drop one at half height ledge (up and right of half height chains).

routes.name: Gem Squash
routes.description: Starts on a small buttress almost touching the path 30m left of the MONSTER cave. Blast through the roofs right of the massive wild fig tree.

routes.name: Butternut
routes.description: The second pitch of GEM SQUASH. Traverse left from the finishing ledge of GEM SQUASH and be prepared for some well deserved ambiance. Can be done in one massive pitch with enough extender slings below the first set of chains. You need at least a 70m rope to do both pitches and reach the ground. A 60m rope will be just good enough to abseil from the final chains.

routes.name: Agoraphobia
routes.description: Shares first 3 clips with GEM SQUASH then break right and onto the face straight through the imposing roof. You can make it 18 if you want to meander left along the tree and up the corner. (Agoraphobia: Fear of open spaces).

routes.name: Leg-o
routes.description: Starts below an obvious fin-like feature through some rock fig branches left of JENGA. Take care of small sections with precariously loose looking rocks.

routes.name: Jenga
routes.description: Shares a start with TOOLBOX, tending left at the 3rd bolt. A true pump-fest at the grade. Use the lonely fixed 'biner out right to make cleaning this route easier, or back clean it.

routes.name: Toolbox
routes.description: Starts 15m left of RODAN in a break through the foliage. Unbelievable that this line has been overlooked.
routes.fa_text: Philippe Gaboriaud and Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: The Engagement Cruise
routes.description: The first line on this face, probably now partially occupied by Toolbox (above). Scramble up left past the start of Rodan, to a narrow ledge. Start on the left of the ledge, just left of the stacked blocks. Straight up a short face, though the overlap and up to below the roof. Rail left to the break in the roof, pull up to the next rail, and then move back right until you can pull up onto the grey ramp. Move slightly left and up the narrow, brown corner, stepping right at the top. Finish up the face between the aloes to the top.

routes.name: Rodan
routes.description: The leftmost line up the long leaning face... At the ledge 8 metres up, look out over the forest, take a deep breath then immerse yourself in 25 metres of pumping orange rock-karate.

routes.name: Godzilla
routes.description: Boven’s 'King Line'. Climb up behind the tree to a ledge then the climbing starts. Up to a shake at a half height then a wicked 10-move boulder problem through the wonderful smooth rock, to good holds. One of the greatest climbs. 70 m rope needed. It is possible to move off-line to a jug far right just before the crux but this is a cop-out and would be graded 30/31.

routes.name: Monster
routes.description: The “baddest” and steepest 29 at Boven!! The only line with ring bolts. Not many small holds on this one, but an absolute pump-fest. Slightly harder (and even better) since the chockstone fell out but still 29.

routes.name: The Beast
routes.description: Start up Monster and move R at the 4th bolt. Some funky moves through the white roof, get a rest in the 'man trap' then finger jugs diagonally to the chains. 70 m rope needed. Low in the grade if you use all the latest tricks. Use slings on the bolts below the roof to reduce drag.

routes.name: Mutation
routes.description: Not the Steve McClure 9a but pretty cool. Climbs Beast until 2/3rds height then shoot straight up the strenuous crack. A nice variation on the original. 31 if you can get the jams right?

routes.name: The Return Of The Overlord - Closed Project
routes.notes: BB Andrew Pedley. MCSA-Boven Fund hardware

routes.name: Space Cadet
routes.description: A massive climb for the space cadets amongst us. A bit of everything from technical arête, burly roof, gnarly crack, exposed handrailing, leaning face..a fantastic ride...Use long slings on the 3 bolts before/in the roof section -that way drag is negligible. There are half height lower off chains. 70 m rope needed.

routes.name: Heavens Above Project
routes.description: An open project, an extension of Freak Show, through the massive overhangs. Only 2-3 metres unsolved to date. Could avoid the Freakshow crux by branching left off Juggernaut.

routes.name: Freak-show
routes.description: Start 2 m left of Freak-on. Climbs the wall just to right of the black water streak (always damp) via thin moves then busts through the roof with effort. Chains are below the huge roofs.

routes.name: Juggernaut
routes.description: Shares the first 3 bolts of Freak-On and then continues straight up through 3 roofs with a hard crux after clipping the last bolt (which has a fixed quickdraw).

routes.name: Freak-on
routes.description: Mega classic! Crimps to the ledge then move right then take the rightwards slanting weakness and much pump. The route remains dry during heavy rain but may seep a little. PLEASE brush the holds when you are done; the climb gets caked and gets no rain.

routes.name: Chocolate Éclair
routes.description: A two bolt boulder problem. Something to throw yourself at when the rain won’t let you climb anywhere else.

routes.name: Who Needs Lucky Cows (aka Death By Chocolate)
routes.description: Climb Chocolate Eclair then continue over the roof with a grunt, then up the headwall. Some very satisfying and crimptastic moves. The route remains dry during heavy rain.

routes.name: Above And Beyond Open Project
routes.description: Open project through the massive horizontal roofs above Lucky Cows, involves a Font 8A+ dyno.

routes.name: Dungeons And Dragons
routes.description: 25 if you can use your feet. This route starts in the corner just right of Chocolate Eclair. Much better than it looks, a great climb. Start up the ramp and into the long overhanging corner behind the trees 20 metres right of Freak-on. Dry in all weather.

routes.name: Tokolosie
routes.description: Sustained with lots and lots of footwork. Easy if good at the latter. Starts off the big ledge up and right of the start of Dungeons. Climb left to get into then up the corner of Dungeons, after 3-4 bolts, break out right through the small roof. Dance up the headwall with a pump. Shares chains of Butcher. Use long slings for the 3 bolts below the roof.

routes.name: The Backcountry Butcher
routes.description: Starts off the same ledge as Tokolosie, or from the ground. Up the orange vertical wall past hard moves including a very defensive little hold, take a rest at the ledge then up the leaning headwall via some real sequency climbing. Don’t get butchered.

routes.name: Changing Gears
routes.description: This is a 3 pitch route that takes the first section of JACK OF ALL TRADES with one new bolt out left onto a ledge. Although it is tempting (yet possible) to do in one long pitch, it is more fun to break it up. A 50m rope will work as all the stances have rap anchors. Pitch 1 - 24, Pitch 2 - 23, Pitch 3 - 25. Pitches 2 & 3 were opened on trad.
routes.fa_text: Jens Richter & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Jack Of All Trades
routes.description: The crackline on the left of big smooth 35metre wall. The original God No! classic. Benchmark 8a. Hard for the short. 70 m rope needed.

routes.name: Jabberwocky
routes.description: The route up the middle of the face, was SA’s hardest climb for many years and still one of the hardest lines in Boven. Solid at the grade, opened at 33. Steel fingers and ace footwork are required. 70 m rope needed.

routes.name: Vorpal Sword
routes.description: The one that killed the Jabberwocky. Crimpy and gymnastic climbing to the right of Jabberwocky, shares first bolt with Hell Yeah. An unbelievable climb, one of best sport pitches in SA. Need a 70 m rope.

routes.name: Hell Yeah!
routes.description: A very long climb which takes the long corner immediately right of Vorpal Sword (shares the first bolt). Not sustained but a superb line. A popular route. Belayer must keep rope close at the ‘3rd crux’ to avoid impact with the ledge! Need a 70 m rope

routes.name: Rock-chuka-chick
routes.description: Starts about 10m right of JABBERWOCKY. A low crux then fun climbing but a bit ledgy. Opened at 24 as went direct where most people skirt left at crux.

routes.name: Purgatory Perhaps?
routes.description: Between Roc Chucka Chic and Big Bad Wolf. NB: This route is 36m long -even with a 70 m rope (tie a a knot in the end!!) the belayer has to climb up onto the first ledge in order to lower the climber.
routes.fa_text: Marc Flex Efune 2015. Hardware provided by MCSA/Boven Fund.

routes.name: Big Bad Wolf
routes.description: 10m right of ROCK-CHUKA-CHICK is another looong route, this one with some fingery technical cruxes.

routes.name: Burning Spear
routes.description: Start up the first 5 bolts of Big Bad Wolf then head right up some good sequential climbing that gets harder as you get higher. A rest before the crux detracts from the climb. A 70m rope is required to get all the way down.

routes.name: Alice In Grannyland
routes.description: Some pleasant face climbing leads to a high crux that if solved correctly is rather easy for the grade. This route is fairly long at 35 odd meters.

routes.name: Gustav’s New Route
routes.description: Start up the first 5 bolts of AIG, then continue along the R bolt line

routes.name: Bittergal
routes.description: Starts to the left of the tree. A tricky looking first few metres on is on dolerite, changing to quartzite after the 3rd bolt.

routes.name: Dendrophilia
routes.description: Love of trees. Just right of BITTERGAL is a recess. Climb the bolts using the tree to get onto the fun stuff. Colin's grab-tree is a rather unique feature on this climb, lets hope it stays there.

routes.name: Brolloks (aka The Day Of The Triffids)
routes.description: Since being bolted this sustained route has become very popular. After the 3rd bolt, move left then up. A 60m rope is needed

routes.name: Goodwill Van Die Zoeloes (aka Groenie Die Drakie)
routes.description: Just R of BROLLOKS. Climb up to the ledge then move left after 4th bolt, and up bolts up to your left. Can also use the BROLLOKS start.

routes.name: Sarel Seemonster
routes.description: Just right of Groenie die Drakie. Again, climb 4 bolts then move left and up. Cruxy.

routes.name: Lucy
routes.description: Clip first 3-4 bolts of Sarel Seemonster then move up R, finishing below the big bushy tree.

routes.name: Last Supper
routes.description: Starts 1m right of Lucy.

routes.name: Grannie's Cottage
routes.description: This route was the old 'Digiridoo Project'.

routes.name: Little Red Riding Hood
routes.description: A super little climb, a great first 24.

routes.name: The Loan Arranger
routes.description: Just right of LRRH. Climb the crack in the middle of the wall, first diagonally right to a thread, then left and up. Hack your way to the top. Don't forget your spade!

routes.name: Him Speak With Forked Tongue
routes.description: Trad line just right of THE LOAN ARRANGER.

routes.name: Halongmaishlong
routes.description: This (rude) line climbs through the overlap from a corner, 15m right of LRRH.

routes.name: I R Baboon
routes.description: The leftmost route on the short unimpressive looking wall as you walk into the crag from the South.

routes.name: Smoking Dread Locks
routes.description: The crack line.

routes.name: Comfort Zone
routes.description: Situated in the middle of the short face on the very left.
routes.fa_text: H. Pringle, G. Frost, N. McKenzie, D. Margetts & A. Grant

routes.name: The Flying Scotsman
routes.description: The desperate looking blank face.

routes.name: Hey Pappa
routes.description: The route is the lonely line on a small open face about 60m left of Dexters Lab. It climbs a prominent crack, after which you pass some ledges and pockets to the left, to gain a thin crack at the top with some technical climbing.

routes.name: Hampster Hotel
routes.description: Start at the coral tree 10m right of HP.

routes.name: Two Cam Sam
routes.description: Start in the corner up to a loose looking block.

routes.name: Rat Palace
routes.description: A little way along the path approaching from the left of Hallucinogen Wall. Climb the face up to a small roof and up to the chains above.
routes.fa_text: Darryl Margetts, G. Frost, H. Pringle

routes.name: Last Hurrah
routes.description: Starts by a tree stump against the rock face 5m right of RP.

routes.name: Roundabout Now
routes.description: 5m left of Bamboozled. Climb corner into the roof. Swing left onto block and up.

routes.name: Manslaves
routes.description: Climb up a face left of a large right facing corner out to a huge cammed block. Swing left under block and up.

routes.name: Bamboozled
routes.description: 10m left of DL. A fine route with an arete high up. Low in the grade.

routes.name: La Croisiere S'amuse
routes.description: Start in the corner left of DEXTER'S LAB. Traverse across the face (Labrat) to above the off-width and a small stance. Climb diagonally left to chains.

routes.name: Lab Rat
routes.description: Climbs up the centre of the blank gently leaning wall via some desperately awkward movements. Starts off the ground at the base of the crack. Clip first bolt with a single screwgate biner from the block. A desperate dyno will see you reach the chains. Needs grade confirmation.

routes.name: Dexter's Lab
routes.description: Climbs the obvious wide layback crack for about 10 m to a ledge. Move up and left off the ledge via some hard to find jugs, through an overhang.

routes.name: Cloud City
routes.description: Climb the face left of SMOKEY up to the overhang, pull through the overhang onto a small ledge, continue up the face to the chains.
routes.fa_text: E Margetts, D Margetts, A Margetts

routes.name: Smokey The Bear
routes.description: Up the groove just left of BONGOLEO.

routes.name: Bongoleo
routes.description: about 5m left of WICKED & 1m R of SMOKEY.

routes.name: Ceasarian
routes.description: Start on BONGOLEO, break up right before the chains to clip 2 hangers and then onto the top groove of WICKED.

routes.name: Wicked
routes.description: Climbs a recessed face about 15m right of DEXTER'S LAB. It is a powerful route and the crux is very hard if you have a small arm span.

routes.name: Drop Kicked
routes.description: 2 Metres right of "Wicked". Some of us were sandbagged when 24 was written at the base after the first ascent!

routes.name: Five Lives Left
routes.description: 2m right of DK. Up the cracks to the roof and out left. Slightly run out! Do not fumble on the second or third clips.

routes.name: Dutch Popcorn
routes.description: Starts behind a bush under an overhanging corner. A great line. Keep your thinking cap on for this route.

routes.name: I Just Can't Bolt It
routes.description: The obvious crack line just right of DP.

routes.name: Searching
routes.description: Climb the recess, break out left past the blocks and through the roof crack and up the face.

routes.name: Lion Hunt
routes.description: Funky face climbing, then through an overlap.

routes.name: Shroom Hunter
routes.description: Left of the open book, railing out right on top.

routes.name: Hemp On The Hill
routes.description: Start one meter left of the open book just right of Shroom Hunter.

routes.name: Ad Maiorem Dei Gloriam
routes.description: Starts 10m right of DP around the corner and 10m left of SSS. Start on ledge 5m off the ground behind large tree.

routes.name: Snakeskin Safari Suit
routes.description: Every beginner should aspire to climb this classic 18. Climb up the right facing corner, left of the M & M face.
routes.fa_text: Greg Devine, Darryl Margetts, N. McKenzie & D. Chesney

routes.name: M & M
routes.description: The blank wall left of the leaning pillar. Hard start then a tricky traverse to the left.

routes.name: The Harder You Push, The Harder It Gets
routes.description: Right side of the leaning pillar. Use the pillar and the face to reach for the base of the shallow recess to the top.  Yes, it rocks!

routes.name: Are You Chicken Enough?
routes.description: A] Climbs the thin crack between THE HARDER YOU PUSH and MOONDANCE, to a set of chains half way up the wall. Opened on trad. Chicken bolts will be added soon.

routes.name: Moondance
routes.description: Climbs the recess about 4m to the right of the loose pillar, for about 15m. Some cranking crack climbing.

routes.name: Loch Ness
routes.description: Start about 1.5 m right of Moon Dance and climbs the vertical face, finishing on the R arête!

routes.name: Morse Code
routes.description: Begins with a boulder problem following the crack 6 m right of Moon Dance.

routes.name: Ants In Your Pants
routes.description: Tackles the short prow with some poor holds! Bouldery and fun.

routes.name: Once In A Blue Moon
routes.description: Climb the corner into chimney onto the face. Either love it or hate it!

routes.name: Blood On The Rocks
routes.description: Goes up and to the left of the arete.

routes.name: Doom
routes.description: Starts in the middle of the face about 2 metres left of CC. Trend leftwards to the arete and then follow break rightwards to the top.

routes.name: Neither Here Nor There
routes.description: Start as for Doom, but stay to the right of the bolts, straight up the face all the way to the top. This route shares the bolts and chains with DOOM.

routes.name: Cenotaph Corner
routes.description: Starts in the obvious corner.

routes.name: Old Crusty's Last Stand
routes.description: Climb up the off width to the ledge above, then follow the open book to the top.

routes.name: Be Quick Or Be Dead
routes.description: Starts on the face just right of the off width crack. Climb the very balancy face without using the corner.

routes.name: High Speed Dirt
routes.description: Start to the right of the face around the corner from WANBT, opposite the large tree. Follow the crack all the way to the top.

routes.name: Women Ain't Nothing But Trouble
routes.description: A great route, questionable name. Start about 3m left of CHICS FOR FREE, climb the face in line with the bolts through a crux and then move right to an obvious layback crack to the chains. Starting on the arête to the left is 22/23.

routes.name: Chics For Free
routes.description: Starts about 10 m around the corner of TP and follows the corner to the top.

routes.name: Fat Annie
routes.description: The bouldery face right of CFF.

routes.name: Slim Jim
routes.description: Takes the line immediately right of Fat Annie, starting behind the bush. It is to the left of The One That Got Away.

routes.name: The One That Got Away
routes.description: The hidden line 4 m right of FAT ANNIE. A tad contrived above the 3rd bolt.

routes.name: Teacher's Pet
routes.description: Start about 4m to the left of the pinnacle.

routes.name: Banging Bridget Jones
routes.description: Climb up the break that kicks back a bit on top.

routes.name: Spicy Haberero Salsa
routes.description: Start on the right of Banging Bridget on the flat holds. Traverse L into the seam and up, moving left into a crack then rightwards and over a rood and crack to finish

routes.name: Zellweger Variation
routes.description: Climb the same as ZELLWEGER and then move off to the left under the roof and pull through to finish on independent chains.

routes.name: Zellweger
routes.description: Starts about 2m to the left of THE PALLBEARER and goes off slightly to the right.

routes.name: The Pallbearer
routes.description: Starts directly below the rap point and directly opposite FISTICUFFS on the pinnacle.

routes.name: Fisticuffs
routes.description: Start on the far right corner of the pinnacle. About opposite ANGEL OF MERCY.

routes.name: It's 13 Jim, But Not As We Know It
routes.description: Start on the far left corner of the pinnacle. Some lateral thinking may be required for this climb.

routes.name: Angel Of Mercy
routes.description: A classic 16 requiring some crack and laybacking skills. Start on the obvious flake.

routes.name: Saint Gabriel
routes.description: Thin face climb between Angel Of Mercy and The Winnebago Smile. Name written on the rock.

routes.name: The Winnebago Smile
routes.description: Climb the thin crack up the shallow recess, and then the crack above to the top.
routes.fa_text: (trad) J Sydow, Phil Lloyd, Ian Manson
routes.notes: (BB Darryl Margetts & Ken Thrash 1999). MCSA bolts

routes.name: Ay Maar Die Mens Is ‘n Wonderlike Ding
routes.description: Climb the short face to a thin seam and up this into a right facing corner. The route name was overheard at the local cafe. This climb was opened on trad, retrobolted and called “YOU MEAN THAT'S IT.”
routes.fa_text: P Lloyd, J Sydow, Ian Manson
routes.notes: BB Ken Thrash & Darryl Margetts 1998 MCSA Bolts

routes.name: Witless
routes.description: Takes the finger crack up the smooth red face. Finger lockin' heaven.

routes.name: Task Saturated
routes.description: Starts about 1.5m right of WITLESS, below the ledge at 2m. Go straight up the face to the undercling, moving left and up to the chains.

routes.name: Santa's Little Helper
routes.description: Follow the line of bolts straight up the face to the left of REMINISCING.
routes.fa_text: Gareth Frost, Ian McMaster & Darryl Margetts

routes.name: Reminiscing
routes.description: This route ascends the corner to the left of PLEASE DONT TOUCH.

routes.name: Please Don't Touch
routes.description: This climb starts about 10m to the right of WITLESS and goes up the south east facing wall. Up to a double crack system. Using both cracks to start with and then using only the right hand one, up to the chains.

routes.name: Champagne On Ice
routes.description: Start on the blocks of PLEASE DON'T TOUCH going right. Pre-clip the first draw and climb up the arete.

routes.name: Dead Ant
routes.description: This climb starts around the corner & to the right of PLEASE DONT TOUCH, and moves out left over the V-shaped roof at about 2m. Using the arete gain the crack system which trends up right to the chains at the top.

routes.name: Wood Pile Crack Variant
routes.description: This route starts as for DEAD ANT and then goes off to the right to gain the hand crack. Follow the crack to the chains.
routes.fa_text: Dave Chesney, Ken Thrash & Darryl Margetts

routes.name: Wood Pile Crack
routes.description: The direct variation of WOOD PILE CRACK.
routes.fa_text: Dave Chesney, Ken Thrash & Darryl Margetts

routes.name: The Trees Are Machines That Make Sweets for the Fish
routes.description: Climb the technical open book right of WOODPILE CRACK. Take care clipping the 3rd bolt.

routes.name: Mountain Pursuit
routes.description: Climb the groove left of GRAVY TRAIN.
routes.fa_text: Bronwyn Smith & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Gravy Train
routes.description: Climb the blobby featured face around the corner of CAPTAIN HOOK. Take care with your rope as there is quite a bit of rope wear when lowering.
routes.fa_text: Darryl Margetts, Gareth Frost & N McKenzie

routes.name: Dead Gecko
routes.description: Just right of Gravy Train.

routes.name: B & B
routes.description: Climb the chimney crack on good pro.

routes.name: Captain Hook
routes.description: Climb the flaring chimney crack right and down around the corner from GRAVY TRAIN.
routes.fa_text: Tim Wilmot, Greg Devine & Darryl Margetts

routes.name: The Claregate
routes.description: Between AUSSIE RULES & CAPTAIN HOOK the route goes up an open book.

routes.name: Aussie Rules
routes.description: Just right of CLAREGATE.

routes.name: Unfinished Business
routes.description: Between Aussie Rules and Face In The Trough.

routes.name: Face In The Trough
routes.description: A face climb staying right of the bolts.

routes.name: Forest Glump
routes.description: Starts on a block, bypasses the overhang and climbs the face to chains on FITT.
routes.fa_text: Greg Devine, Darryl Margetts, Tim Wilmot & Dave Chesney

routes.name: Lining Your Pockets
routes.description: The line of bolts to the left of MFG. Step left onto the face after the 4th bolt.

routes.name: Mission From Glod
routes.description: Starts in the corner below the small roof. Above the roof climb the open book to the chains.

routes.name: Sand Glod
routes.description: This is a variation to MISSION FROM GLOD (MFG). Start up the break in the face to the right of MFG and move back into the open book above the small roof and finish on the last 6 bolts of MFG to finish on the same chains.

routes.name: Panty-slapped
routes.description: The arête behind the tree. Super technical on-balance moves, low in the grade.

routes.name: Emancipated Spider Chicks
routes.description: Climb the face to the left of BUTTERFLY SNOWSTORM.

routes.name: Butterfly Snowstorm
routes.description: Climb the left facing corner just L of ROCKY'S.
routes.fa_text: Dave Chesney, Darryl Margetts, Greg Devine & Tim Wilmot

routes.name: Clockwork Orange
routes.description: Starts in same place as Butterfly Snowstorm but moves out rightwards

routes.name: Clockwork Orange Variation
routes.description: Starts 2m left of ROCKY and joins CLOCKWORK Orange after 2nd bolt.

routes.name: Rocky's
routes.description: This climb starts on the far right hand side, starting at the bottom of the steep descent on the walk in.

routes.name: Iron Lotus
routes.description: Climb the thin face just right of rocky, staying on the face (Going left makes it easier).

routes.name: The Ladder
routes.description: Right of the above.

routes.name: Fadja's Revenge
routes.description: 5 meters to the right of the Ladder

routes.name: Zooter
routes.description: Climb a short face,move right to a layback and continue to chains

routes.name: Golden Pie
routes.description: Climb layback crack

routes.name: Brunch
routes.description: The best route at the crag, climbs a blunt arête feature. Step left at the top

routes.name: Chicken Wing
routes.description: Climb short face and arete

routes.name: Spare Rib
routes.description: Climb break to the right of Chicken Wing
routes.fa_text: Margetts E Margetts and A Margetts

routes.name: Crack Up
routes.description: Climb the break 20 meters to the right of Spare Rib

routes.name: Kiri
routes.description: To the right of CRACK UP, around the corner. Climb the arete on the left.

routes.name: I Dexe
routes.description: The direct line just L of CACTUS PALACE.

routes.name: Cactus Palace
routes.description: The obvious bolted diagonal line provides some cool sequences.

routes.name: For Your Colorfication
routes.description: The hard-looking face climb to the right of CACTUS PALACE.

routes.name: Kimchi
routes.description: Up the tricky steep face then some easier climbing before a testing finish. The extra bolts at the penultimate bolt are not the chains, just a mistake by the bolter. Solid 7b+.

routes.name: Doug In The Yellow House
routes.description: Starts on tree roots 20 m left of Snapdragon. Tenuous laybacks lead to great climbing through the roofs to the chains. Really good and not a giveaway!

routes.name: Coach
routes.description: Dedicated to Heiko Tillwick -Rest in Peace, Coach. Start up the roots about 10 m left of Snapdragon. Some awkward fingery cruxes keep your brain busy.
routes.notes: BB: Tim Dunnett and Dirk Smith.

routes.name: Suspension Trauma
routes.description: Situated 15m left of the drip up a slightly overhanging face. Sadly some TV sized blocks took out a tree and some bushes at the base. Otherwise it has wild moments and good preparation for those wanting to go full animal.
routes.fa_text: Philippe Grandremy and Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Power Animal
routes.description: The line between Coach and Full Animal. Start by the white-stemmed tree and veer right onto the clean face after the third bolt. Choose your power animal wisely for the two distinctly different cruxes. Beware of wasps in the crack above the third bolt.

routes.name: Full Animal
routes.description: Several meters left of Snapdragon, right of Coach. Use slings on the three bolts after the half-height rest. Remember to go full animal on the lip of the roof.

routes.name: A Life In Orange -open Project (
routes.description: Tried by a few strong locals and foreigners. One really reachy awkward section! Clip the first couple of bolts on Frazzle then move left and up on small holds. Just when you think you have pulled hard enough,  the crux appears; a long move from a break. Reach will help. An amazing line.

routes.name: Frazzle
routes.description: The blankness just left of Snapdragon. A couple of extremely poor holds on the face lead to easier ground. Opended at 31 – did some holds fall off?!

routes.name: Snapdragon
routes.description: Still SA’s most famous sport climb. It offers superb endurance climbing and requires plenty of finesse. It is on every visitor’s ticklist and is starting to become very well used. Please brush the holds when you are done.

routes.name: Hack And Slay
routes.description: Starts 6m right of Snapdragon and tackles the lovely looking smooth open corner using some rather small holds. Hard for the short.

routes.name: The Next Generation
routes.description: The route previously known as 'The Broject' starts up the choss pillar 10 m right of Snapdragon. A short easy face leads into Boven's answer to Rocklands roof bouldering. Get creative (and strong!) and enjoy the wild horizontal ride.

routes.name: Open Project
routes.description: Climb Giants. From the last bolt before the chains go diagonally left into the roofs. See if you can decipher the hard move at the final roof. An alternative start is to link Karfoefelling or Ovamboland into Giant's crux

routes.name: Giants
routes.description: Starts about 30 metres right of Snapdragon up some loose looking (but solid) rock. A hard crux (knocking on 7c) unless you can jam it...

routes.name: Karfoefeling
routes.description: Awesome. Starts on RUDE BUSHMAN or WELCOME TO OVAMBOLAND, then go left and up to pass some overlaps, finishing at half height chains. A popular first 26.

routes.name: Loslappie Link-up
routes.description: The line that should have been here first! Start up WTO for 2-3 bolts then move left onto KARFOEFELING; then after clipping 2 bolts on the face above the last roof/overlap section, move back onto WTO at the juggy break (rest) on the slabby part. Then load your forearms and blast up the incredible leaning headwall to the top of the crag!

routes.name: Welcome To Ovamboland
routes.description: Blasts straight up to top of the crag via awkward pulls in the roof. Opened using the left sequence (impossible for the short) at the crux but a sequence on the right is possible.

routes.name: Rude Bushman
routes.description: This route starts 3m left of Lotters Desire starting with a little overlap then heads rightwards into a niche, then up and left through a small roof. Low in grade, probably 6c+.

routes.name: Hard Normal Daddy
routes.description: Climb the obvious corner right of Rude Bushman.

routes.name: Lotta Desire
routes.description: The amazing orange wall. Five stars for the beauty of the line, and the climbing is pretty good too. Tricky start (easier on the left) then up (dubbed Hectors Desire)
routes.notes: (BB) Gary Lotter. RB Jan 2010 MCSA bolts.

routes.name: Hypertension
routes.description: A brilliant climb, so unique! Requires a bit of everything -stamina, finger strength, reach, excellent footwork, so much fun. Easy 8a..

routes.name: Tugela Blue
routes.description: This route blasts through the roofs on jugs, heading slightly right. Pre clipping the 3rd bolt and unclipping bolts 1 and 2 avoids rope drag.

routes.name: Out On A Limb
routes.description: A super line!! A bolt added in 2012 to make the start less scary. Walk out along the left limb of the big fig tree. Fight through the initial overhang and fire up the headwall above to the chains with a distressing pump.

routes.name: Soul Mandate
routes.description: Start between the fork of the White tree about 5m left of Miss McKinley. A thuggish start leads to some good climbing above.

routes.name: Thunderstuck
routes.description: Start steep under the overhang left of Miss Mac.
routes.fa_text: Mel and Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Miss Mckinley
routes.description: 30 m right of Lotters Desire. Starts on bouldery moves just left of a bushy tree.

routes.name: The Doomsday Device
routes.description: Start up the first 5 bolts of Miss Mckinley and then head right and up past some strenuous sidepulling.

routes.name: Strata
routes.description: Doesn’t look hard from below but an absence of any useful holds on the headwall gives plenty of spice. Solid 8b. Starts just left of Tripolactic.

routes.name: Tripolactic Fairytales
routes.description: Up the technical face then right-facing corner above. Was 27 then 26, now definitely 27....
routes.fa_text: Will Watkins 1998 (BB) Darryl Margetts & Matt Murison. New chains and bolts 1-5 (Feb 2011)

routes.name: Beehive
routes.description: Just right of TRIPOLACTIC FAIRYTALES there is a tree growing on the rock. The route starts right of the roots. Move leftward toward the recess above and then up the wall to the left. Take care of the bees.

routes.name: Tree House
routes.description: Goes through the tree roots as for BEEHIVE to the recess. Take care of the bees.

routes.name: Paradise By The C
routes.description: Takes the steep line just to the right of the tree growing up the cliff.

routes.name: Hallucenogenic Toreador
routes.description: Quality! Do the dyno, rest then either power gaston or use your brain.

routes.name: Brain Damaged
routes.description: Newish route to the right of Hallucinagenic Toreador.

routes.name: Sleepless Tad
routes.description: About 10m right of the tree roots is a bolt at 5-6m. You need extra natural gear. Follow the two bolts and crack to overhang. Some of the bolts removed in 2014 so may not be possible.

routes.name: Club Tropicana Coconuts
routes.description: Up the middle of the wall, about 8 meters left of Glen.

routes.name: Le Sketch
routes.description: The route starts just to the left of GLEN and fires through the small roof 5m below the top of the crag. Some smooth rock and reach moves low down!

routes.name: Glen
routes.description: Overbolted but fun. A great combination, often referred to as ‘Le Combo’ (22); start up Glen then move left onto Le Sketch on the midway ledge. Place a long draw before moving onto Le Sketch.

routes.name: Into The Black
routes.description: Just left of Precision Feather. Heavily overbolted, can skip almost every other bolt.

routes.name: Precision Feather
routes.description: A super climb! One of the better 21’s in Boven. The right most climb on this section of wall. Up then across a bushy face and more climbing above.

routes.name: Almost My Balls
routes.description: The first line around the corner, right of Precision Feather. Hard and scary if you can’t reach the layback!

routes.name: Penny Royal Tee
routes.description: A super climb, trending up and left up the slabby face.
routes.fa_text: Darryl Margetts, Mark Philipps & Andrew Lynch

routes.name: Teen Spirit
routes.description: The climb starts in the obvious crack. Climb this crack until it is possible to move out left. Continue up the face to finish with a mantle at the top to clip the chains.
routes.fa_text: Ken Thrash, Mark Phillips, Darryl Margetts & Dave Chesney

routes.name: Why
routes.description: Climbs the easy break left of HTG up to a tree.

routes.name: Herman The German
routes.description: Climb up the next route to the recess, rail 2m left and then up the headwall.

routes.name: Herman's Route
routes.description: Stick clip the 1st bolt or place friends. Move up wall to gain recess. Climb right and up to a tree. There are no anchors.

routes.name: True Blue
routes.description: Takes the corner left of WYSIWYG. Route may be retrobolted -see WYSIWYG description.

routes.name: Wysiwyg
routes.description: Climbs the obvious corner ramp to the left of the large stacked roofs. Permission has been given for this route to be retrobolted as long as the opening party & route names remain the same.

routes.name: Chunky Monkey
routes.description: A classic. The route climbs a really obvious square arête then rails out rightwards wildly! Low in grade.

routes.name: Hounds Mousse
routes.description: Through the groove 8m right of Chunky Monkey.

routes.name: New York Chocolate Fudge Crunch
routes.description: This route takes the next arete right of Chunky Monkey. The lower offs are too small to fit both rope & draws  when cleaning.

routes.name: Home Alone
routes.description: Climb the corner and up a short v-groove to the top. Route may be retrobolted.

routes.name: Puppet On A String
routes.description: About 50-60m along right from the descent gulley is a shallow corner. Just left is a fine looking crack. Climb the crack.

routes.name: Through The Looking Glass
routes.description: The shallow corner. Route may be retrobolted -see WYSIWYG’s description.

routes.name: Balrog
routes.description: The line left of Transmogrifier.

routes.name: Transmogrifier
routes.description: A short but fun climb. Start on the block below the obvious V-groove. Name written at base of the climb. Rather easy for 26.

routes.name: Uiters Tors
routes.description: Trad route between Transmogrifier & Endless October. Climbs a gnarly thin seam & trends up & left. Poor gear.
routes.fa_text: Stewart Middlemiss, Mike Hislop, Clive Curson & Chris Lomax

routes.name: Endless October
routes.description: Starts at the left end of the ledge/block. Brilliant.

routes.name: Sweet Cousin Cocaine
routes.description: From the right of the block climb past a bouldery lower section then a finish on huge jugs. Superb.

routes.name: Night Of The Toast
routes.description: The obvious crackline on the left of The Theatre, just right of Sweet Cousin Cocaine.

routes.name: Mankini Blue
routes.description: A crimpers delight! Climb first couple bolts of Bikini then branch left and up the crimpy wall.

routes.name: Bikini Red
routes.description: Stunning! I dare say..it’s better than Lottas! In the middle of the face. Name written at base. The first bolt is very high but the climbing is super easy. Don’t stray left at the top, just trust those feet and go!

routes.name: Shut Up And Die Like An Aviator
routes.description: Climbs the scoop 5m right of BIKINI RED. Very poorly protected.

routes.name: Stage Fright
routes.description: Climbs the arete to the choss above.

routes.name: Centre Stage
routes.description: This is the leftmost route on the right wall of The Theatre. Climbs the corner. Fight your way through the choss at the top and avoid killing people below.

routes.name: Into The Night We Slide
routes.description: Excellent and sustained. Just to the right of the major dihedral in The Theatre, a few metres left of HEART OF CHINA. Sparse gear.

routes.name: Heart Of China
routes.description: CLASSIC!! Up the middle of the big left facing orange wall, via a leftwards trending line of cracks and jugs. One of the best trad lines at The Restaurant.

routes.name: Big In Japan
routes.description: The bolts up the black looking vertical face protect a thin but super line. BB Danny Pinkus.

routes.name: Kindred Spirits
routes.description: At the right end of the ledge, climb up a few moves, and right around the corner to under a roof (awkward 2nd clip out left). Opened at 25.

routes.name: Star Gazers
routes.description: Approximately 30m right of THE THEATRE, are a pair of open books at the top of the crag. They are 10m apart -the right hand one has a pillar at its foot and a tree 5m up. Start below this one. Gain the ledge below the tree and then follow the crack above to the top of the pillar below the open book. Climb this and exit left. Apparently hard to find placements for the belay at the top.
routes.fa_text: Russ Dodding, M Erens & G Erens 1992

routes.name: Waiting For Gossip
routes.description: Climbs the corner to the left of Shear Force. Scramble up to the tree on the left and traverse to a ledge on the right (bolt). Climb the corner to a roof, pull through and up to a tree at the top.
routes.fa_text: Stewart Middlemiss, Chris Lomax & Richard Lord 1992

routes.name: Shear Force
routes.description: Boven's hardest line! And worthy of the crown, being long, steep and of continually interesting climbing. Take the obvious 20 degree leaning wall. Scramble up to start with a hollow flake and a hard move left to the arête. Then lots of sidepulling leads to a desperate campussing crux.

routes.name: Damn The Torpedoes
routes.description: Climb the ‘’Indian Creek’’ type corner a few meters to the right of Shear Force. Scramble a long way up and belay off the ledge. Great climbing with a single stopper crux.

routes.name: Mind’s A Blank (open) Project.
routes.description: Some bolts on the blank face above a ledge, left of Joy Division
routes.notes: BB: Danny Pinkus and Tessa Little

routes.name: Joy Division
routes.description: Need a 70 m rope to get down! The rough textured blank wall. Climb slightly rightwards with difficulty up the thin face, until you can move back left to reach the base of the corner. Carry on to the top. Originally graded 29. Totally impossible if you are short..go on, prove me wrong!

routes.name: Collapse Of Reason
routes.description: The left route.

routes.name: Rise Of Faith
routes.description: The right route.

routes.name: Unexplored Galaxy
routes.description: Around the corner of Rise of Faith.

routes.name: Nothing In Moderation
routes.description: Slab route at the water's edge. Take a toothbrush to clean after rain.

routes.name: The Dark Side
routes.description: Another slab route, 3-4m right.

routes.name: Just Stick It
routes.description: Short power face problem, the leftmost in The Gym.

routes.name: Booger Being
routes.description: Sustained powerful route up the arete.

routes.name: Monks In The Gym
routes.description: Mega power problem just right of the arete. Stick clip the first bolt.

routes.name: Monkey Monkey
routes.description: Route with power start, 3m right of the arete. Burly.

routes.name: Nuns On The Run
routes.description: Starts just right of MONKEY MONKEY. Thin start.

routes.name: Lithium
routes.description: The original route here. About 2-3m left of the gulley.

routes.name: Any Objections
routes.description: Follows a crack line just left of the gulley corner on the right of the face.

routes.name: Troubled Waters
routes.description: This route is most easily reached by turning left at the stream lookout where the path first comes down from the campsite. The path goes down to a plateau next to the river. Cross the river at the lip of the first waterfall. Please be careful -at least one person has fallen off here already. The route is up the little face just on the other side. There are some good holds -separated by hard moves.

routes.name: Shadow Man
routes.description: Climb the sequential left hand edge from a hanging stance to a single bolt. Can be dusty.

routes.name: Mind Games - Open Project
routes.description: Starts just right of SHADOW MAN. This project was bolted by Alex Bester and Wesley Black. If you are keen to try it, contact Alex or Wesley. Probably well into the thirties and an amazing line.
routes.notes: BB Alex Bester and Wesley Black Oct 2010. MCSA bolts

routes.name: Too Early For The Sky
routes.description: [GPS: S25 39 10.4 E30 20 56.0] Rap down 200m along from the ab-in routes at the gym. Some top bolts are found 25m before reaching the Time Bomb Block. Use the chains to ab to a stance slightly left. Enjoy the view. A fine rap-bolting affair.

routes.name: Too Late For The Stars
routes.description: A great route to see if you like heights or not. Start 10m right of TEFTS.

routes.name: The World Is Not Enough
routes.description: [GPS: S25 39 10.3 E30 20 55.5] Ab in 15 right of TLFTS. Be aware that you need to pendulum to the left to reach the stance, keep a sling or quick draw handy.

routes.name: Cotopaxi
routes.description: Climbs the wall 10 -20m left of IIM. This route climbs a thin (#1 Rock) size crack up the wall. Traverse left at top to avoid vegetation.

routes.name: Bumblies Have Feelings Too
routes.description: The leftmost route on u-bolts with a thin start.

routes.name: Incidentally I'm Macho
routes.description: Climb the flakey break 5m left of the arete. Step left and climb straight up to the break in the vegetation. One of the top 19's at Boven.

routes.name: Actually You're A Wimp
routes.description: Start with 2 bolts as for IIM. Fire straight up the wall on u-bolts to lower-offs.

routes.name: It
routes.description: Clip 3 bolts on AYAW. Trend right into a break and up.

routes.name: Super Ego
routes.description: The arete.

routes.name: The Cat In The Hat
routes.description: Approach by scrambling down the chimney behind the 2nd apartment-sized hanging block. Climb the overhanging rock in the small theatre, past two bolts, exiting up the left hand crack.

routes.name: Dances With Wombats
routes.description: Start 5m below and just to the left of VOL LIBRE. This somewhat runout route shares the last bolt and chains of VL. Please note this route is 28m long. Do not screw up your approach.

routes.name: Vol Libre
routes.description: Awesome face climbing off the extreme left hand edge of the small subsidiary ledge. Translation: "Free falling." Belay off cold shuts and top out if you want.

routes.name: Danse De La Pluie
routes.description: "Rain dance" shoots up right of VL on u-bolts with a tricky start.

routes.name: Mr Jive
routes.description: The arete on the lower buttress.

routes.name: Dr Heckyl
routes.description: Shares bolt 1 and chains with Mr Jive. Stay out of the corner.

routes.name: Keep The Faith
routes.description: Starts up a steep corner at the left edge of the main ledge area. Mega pump with crux at last move.

routes.name: Mercury Rev
routes.description: Wild pump up mega steep rock just to the right of KEEP THE FAITH's corner. Can be dusty if not climbed recently.

routes.name: The Surge
routes.description: The line R of MR.

routes.name: Smelt
routes.description: Great route with a "go-for-it" crux, about 10m left of the right hand edge of this wall.

routes.name: Zoozania
routes.description: Climbs the diagonal to the left of JITF. Take 4 long quick draws for the roof going diagonally up right. A.k.a. “Snake.”

routes.name: Jump In The Fire
routes.description: A wild route on monster holds. Starts at the right hand edge of the main face; then rails out horizontally along the side of the roof. The climb is clearly visible from the top of the crag.

routes.name: Coal Man
routes.description: Starts about 7m south of the rock platform. Climb the slanting crack to the R and pull the roof to chains.

routes.name: Coke Stoker
routes.description: The next 4 routes are on the E face of the Rock Platform. This route starts about 4m from the prominent dihedral.

routes.name: Smoulder
routes.description: Fun but reachy. 6m left of the corner.

routes.name: Smeltdown
routes.description: Starts in a corner about 8m right of a large dihedral. Pull left after a few metres, then up SMOULDER to the chains. This bypasses the obvious fierce reach move. Can be used to climb out from the crag at the end of the day.

routes.name: Meltdown
routes.description: [GPS: s25 39 10.5 E30 21 03.0] Starts in SMELTDOWN'S corner. Move up then right towards the skyline arete; yard up on growing incuts.

routes.name: Beauty
routes.description: Feel like an adventure? Walk left from the abseil point along the ledge to where it ends below an open recess and to the right of a prominent nose 8m up. This point is about 10m above the base of the cliff and 15m to the right of the prominent recess, marked with bird-lime, cutting through the entire height of the cliff. Climb up the corner to where it is possible to move diagonally up left onto the massive blocks on the right-hand side of the nose. Step left and up onto the face above. Move diagonally left onto a ledge. Belay on the left. Make a strenuous take-off from the right hand side of the ledge and continue awkardly up the left slanting crack to where it is possible to step left to a small ledge. Climb up and then move diagonally back right on good hand holds across an exposed face to a line of flakes sloping up left. Climb to the top of this and continue up the steep face above to the top.

routes.name: Corney
routes.description: The upper part of the climb follows the prominent, clean, right- facing corner about 20m left of the abseil point. Start just right of the prominent overhangs 10m up and climb the crack leading into a left facing corner, which goes through a steep, glossy face to a sloping ledge below the upper corner. Continue up the corner to the top.

routes.name: Abroute
routes.description: Nowadays people usually rap in using the chains of SMOULDER or SMELTDOWN. This route follows the abseil line up to the abseil tree (large stamvrug). Start up the right leaning crack and climb it via a tricky layback move before stepping left to a resting point below the small overhang. Climb straight up through the overhang to the tree.

routes.name: Offroute
routes.description: Start up ABROUTE and then climb the recess on the right.

routes.name: Referendum
routes.description: Abseil off the big stamvrug and then walk back 40m along the ledge towards The Restaurant. In a corner is a steep, right leaning layback crack. To the left of the corner are two very steep jam cracks, either side of a huge block. Climb the corner crack to the ledge -escape up and leftwards. This line joins the now bolted SMELTDOWN.

routes.name: Shifting The Goalposts
routes.description: Starts below the 15cm wide corner-crack to the right of the abseil tree. Climb the corner crack for 2m, traverse right across the slab The and then gain the ledge up to the right. Ascend the delightful wall above, trending diagonally R to the blocky ledge.

routes.name: Cucumber Zoo
routes.description: Climb the cool corner. Harder for midgets. Use this route to ab in.

routes.name: Nine Inch Nails
routes.description: Climb just R of the big roof and corner on the L of the wall. The route takes three overlaps en route to the top.

routes.name: Cut Me Some Slack
routes.description: The line just R of NIN.

routes.name: Nailing Jelly To The Ceiling
routes.description: This shares the first and last bolt with the previous route. Reachy.

routes.name: Halfway House
routes.description: Rap down 5m right of the previous routes, some 15m from the big corner, to a belay above the roof or aid up to the stance using the 3 bolts under the overlap.

routes.name: Funky Acid Trip
routes.description: Around the arete and corner -it starts about 5m from the corner.

routes.name: Acid On The Brain
routes.description: Starting about 8m from the corner, climb past 5 bolts. After the roof move slightly left, and head for the top.

routes.name: Mister Excellent
routes.description: Starts left of the corner arête. The route is probably a grade easier for tall persons and harder for midgets.

routes.name: German Cannibal
routes.description: The obvious arête at the far right hand end of the crag, probably very good.

routes.name: New Age
routes.description: [ GPS: S25 39 12.6 E30 21 11.0] Start up the corner crack for 6m, then head up the wall.

routes.name: Joyride
routes.description: Climb the previous crack to the top of the pillar. Step right to a good crack. Climb this to lower offs.

routes.name: The Gallery
routes.description: Steep start to a great face/corner. Stiff take-off.

routes.name: I Guest Not
routes.description: Steep powerful arete just right of THE GALLERY.

routes.name: First Assignment
routes.description: Classic at its grade. A vertical wall facing north.

routes.name: Purple Droll
routes.description: Climb the thin crack about 30m left of WORLDS APART and around the corner. Climb up to a tree and into a chimney.

routes.name: Attack Of The Killer Tree
routes.description: The route to the left of the dead tree.

routes.name: Not The Nine O'clock News
routes.description: This climb used to start up a tree which has fallen away. The start is probably considerably trickier now and may a bolt or two..

routes.name: The Playpen
routes.description: Just to the right of the chimney-with-teeth. Airy at the top.

routes.name: Jambo
routes.description: Climbs a small arete to a roof 5m up. Then take the left break up to anchors. One of best routes in Boven.

routes.name: Flambeau
routes.description: Start up the 1st 4 bolts of JAMBO, then somewhat right to chains. Don't relax too much on the headwall…

routes.name: Limbo Direct
routes.description: Direct start past a bolt to lunge for the branch.

routes.name: Limbo
routes.description: Climb the tree roots 7m right of JAMBO, walk left along the limb, then up the wall to chains. Great climbing -after the tree.

routes.name: Jigaboo
routes.description: An excellent line, so much fun.

routes.name: World's Apart
routes.description: A classic finger crack, in the middle of the Restaurant crag. Retrobolted by Lobster himself. One of the first routes here.
routes.notes: First Climb in opened in Boven

routes.name: Looking For The Lobster
routes.description: About 8m right of the WORLD'S APART fingercrack. Keep to the left through the tree to reach good climbing up the crack and face above.

routes.name: Access Route To Gretchen Et Al
routes.description: Climb up 7 bolts on a line just left of BONAR and step left to Gretchen's stance. The next 4 routes can be done from this large ledge.

routes.name: Red Harvest
routes.description: 3m right of LFTL, starting on the lower Gretchen ledge. Can be climbed from the bottom, go right around the tree.

routes.name: Jungle Uncle
routes.description: Climbs the shallow corner to the left of GRETCHEN GOES TO NEBRASKA.

routes.name: Gretchen Goes To Nebraska
routes.description: From the belay bolts on the large ledge, climb the face route left of the obvious corner.

routes.name: Amazon Aunt
routes.description: Bolted jamcrack just right of Gretchen, on the same ledge. Great climb to practice trad leading.

routes.name: Out Through The In Door
routes.description: Up the ACCESS ROUTE TO GRETCHEN ET AL; at the top of the dihedral, climb the left hand crack on the face. Gary Lotter's IN THROUGH THE OUT DOOR probably goes out onto the arete now occupied by BONAR.

routes.name: In Through The Out Door
routes.description: Climbs the line 7m right of GRETCHEN GOES TO NEBRASKA, on the face left of the arete. Dicey gear, mostly small wires.

routes.name: Bonar
routes.description: GPS: S25 39 11.3 E30 20 48.0] Fine moves up the steep left arete on positive holds. Long and pumpy.

routes.name: Mjs
routes.description: A hardish move through the groove near the ground.

routes.name: G.p. Le Chuck
routes.description: Starts as for RED HERRING, then goes left after the first bolt. Somewhat contrived finishing crux.

routes.name: Red Herring
routes.description: A fine climb up the middle of the face.

routes.name: Faraday's Cage
routes.description: Starts a few meters right of RED HERRING, up the right side of the face. Recently rebolted by Darryl.

routes.name: Atomic Aardvark
routes.description: A hallowed classic. Starts up a small corner on the left of the buttress after a short scramble from the base. Can skip some of the bolts, especially at the start to reduce drag.

routes.name: The Gift
