routes.description: WOW! A graceful sweep of technicality, possibly best 27 in Boven. Up the centre of the buttress starting from the base. Some extra bolts made it less sporty some years back.

routes.name: The Fix
routes.description: Starts from a stance 8 metres up. Rap down to the first bolt. One of the harder excruciatingly technical climbs around.

routes.name: Achtung Baby
routes.description: Starts from the top of a pillar around the corner from the main Buttress. This can be accessed either by rapping or scrambling up from the right.

routes.name: Zoo Station
routes.description: 2m right of ACHTUNG BABY.

routes.name: L'il Arete Number
routes.description: About 8m right of the ZOO STATION Pillar. Approach from the right and scramble up to belay at the first bolt.

routes.name: First Dimension
routes.description: Belay at LAN's first bolt. Climb the seam. Finish up right. Use LAN's lower-offs.

routes.name: Pocket Rocket
routes.description: 8m right of FIRST DIMENSION. Short and bouldery, not a giveaway.

routes.name: Lounge Lizard
routes.description: The leftmost route on the face near the corner. Reachy.

routes.name: Brain Dead
routes.description: Starts up a diagonal seam from a ledge about 4m from the corner on the left of the face.

routes.name: Gaper Caper
routes.description: Step off the right edge of the ledge -climb the face to the top.

routes.name: Grockel Mania
routes.description: Start 2m right of the ledge.

routes.name: Gaper Trail
routes.description: Climb up as for TO GAPE OR NOT TO BE, then break up left past two bolts and a #3.5 friend placement.

routes.name: To Gape Or Not To Be
routes.description: Climb the seam on the right (wires), then up the wall above past two bolts.

routes.name: Deck Chair
routes.description: Very thin moves up the blank slab 10m right of GROCKEL MANIA. Gets easier after a few moves.

routes.name: Gaper Go-go
routes.description: Start below the triangular corner. Trend slightly left towards the top.

routes.name: Passion Play
routes.description: Start on the left almost under the tree. Tricky move left near the top.

routes.name: Crown Of Thorns
routes.description: Start as for PASSION PLAY. Continue up the diagonal line across the face to the top.

routes.name: Last Station
routes.description: Straight up the right hand side of the face.

routes.name: Andy's Line
routes.description: Starts right of a ledge that is 5m off the ground on the far left. This route goes up a dark blunt arete to chains. Don't be temted to tend left.

routes.name: Psychedelic Sandwich
routes.description: Starts 3m left of the TF corner. Move a bit right after reaching through the overlap. The name is scratched onto the rock.

routes.name: Tropical Front
routes.description: Up the face left of obvious open corner. Stay 1m left of the HT crack. TF is scratched onto the rock.
routes.fa_text: Gunther Migeotte, Rachel Kelsey & Raylene Davidson

routes.name: Hammer Time
routes.description: Starts up the corner just right of TF. Pull through roof on the left, then up the face right of the corner on small holds.

routes.name: Gung Ho
routes.description: Starts 2m right of the step down to a lower tier. Uses thin crack and arete to reach the crux overlap.

routes.name: The Ego Has Landed
routes.description: Starts just left of the tree up a corner crack 2m right of GH. Some big loose looking blocks on this one.

routes.name: Glass And A Half
routes.description: Breaks right onto the slab from the corner crack on TEHL just before the crux layback at the second bolt.

routes.name: Anthem For Doomed Youth
routes.description: Blank looking face 2m left of the lowest tier.

routes.name: Wild Hearted Son
routes.description: Just around the arete, up the undercut face. The name is scratched onto the rock.

routes.name: Angel Dust
routes.description: Up the hard-looking right-slanting crack 8m right of WHS.

routes.name: Rainbow Children
routes.description: The line up overlaps on the corner 3m right of AD.

routes.name: Surf's Up
routes.description: The left route. A variety of unusual moves.

routes.name: Billabong
routes.description: Starts 5m right of SU, on a small arete. Pull it.

routes.name: Ripcurl
routes.description: Start in the corner 3m right of BILLABONG. Great technical climbing, getting steadily trickier.

routes.name: Country Feeling
routes.description: 4m right of Rip Curl's corner is a 3-4 cm crack. Climb it to the face above.

routes.name: Quicksilver
routes.description: 6-7 metres right of Rip Curl is another boltline near a block. Climb the face. If you use the block to the right, the route can be 18/19. Ends near the ledge on the right.

routes.name: Pending Investigation
routes.description: The rightmost route, hidden just left of the obvious recess. 3m from the righthand edge of the buttress.

routes.name: Amazonian War Dance
routes.description: Climbs the face and arete at the end of the first wall on the right looking down the gulley (opposite LJS).

routes.name: Long John Silver
routes.description: About 15m down the gulley on the left. Climb the face to a small roof.

routes.name: Rock Island
routes.description: The seam just right of LJS. Opened on natural gear in the dark ages. Unintentionally retrobolted and renamed Fantasia.
routes.fa_text: S Middlemiss, W Jenkin & C Curson

routes.name: Face The Music
routes.description: The thin face just right of Rock Island.

routes.name: Return To The Wolgan Valley
routes.description: The smooth-looking slab 15m down from Rock Island. Low in the grade.

routes.name: Allegro Non Troppo
routes.description: 5m right of RTTWV. This face has a thin start.

routes.name: Gert’s Nineteen
routes.description: About 10m down from Allegro Non Troppo.

routes.name: Gloin
routes.description: Climbs up to the prominent roof crack after the gully.

routes.name: Rain Man
routes.description: Contender for best 21 in Boven. A superb climb! Start in little alcove, name written on rock, same start as Mrs D but branch left. Go all the way to the top of the cliff.

routes.name: Mrs Doubtfire
routes.description: Crack line on the right of Rain Man. A touch runout on the crux -take a Friend 1.5 if you're worried. Easy if you are comfortable at this grade. Name written on rock, same start as Rain Man.

routes.name: Old Spice
routes.description: The leftmost of the 3 obvious lines on the face, name written on the rock. Brilliant.

routes.name: Shrine Of The Sea Monkeys
routes.description: Just maybe the best 25 in Boven?! The middle route. Stiff start (easier on right) to cool-headed cranking up the headwall. Very spaced bolts but safe. Maybe not the best choice unless you are comfortable on 24!

routes.name: Castaway
routes.description: Starts up the arete on the right. Fingery face to a great rest then some intense moves onto the headwall, its all over very quickly, either smiling of sagging in your harness! Quite a stretch to clip the crux bolt. The name is written on the rock.

routes.name: Clockwork Monkey
routes.description: Starts off the platform halfway up the wall 15m right of Castaway.

routes.name: Comedy Waltz
routes.description: Starts 5m right of Clockwork Monkey at the same level.

routes.name: Friday
routes.description: Climb the left of the pillar, 25m beyond Castaway. Keep right of the third bolt. Fairly challenging at 23! About 19 if you stray too far to the left.

routes.name: Spring Tide
routes.description: Up the middle of the pillar. No shortage of bolts.

routes.name: Beach Cocktail
routes.description: Climb the right hand edge of the pillar.

routes.name: Africa Trip
routes.description: Starts about 10m right of the pillar, on the main wall. Very lead out with only a single top anchor. A good route, anyone please add another top anchor.

routes.name: Dassieburger
routes.description: 5m right of Africa Trip, up the blunt arete. Take care on this route with only 1 top anchor.

routes.name: Enchantress
routes.description: A trad line through the roof 15m right of DASSIEBURGER.

routes.name: Shiver Me Timbers
routes.description: Starts off the left hand edge of a wide ledge (facing west) up the blunt arete about 20m right of Wizards. Bolt hangers on top. Exposed belay.

routes.name: Blunt Blade
routes.description: The bolted face right of the arete and 2-3 m left of the 2 prominent cracks (By Hook Or By Crook, Tinkerbell). Look high past the the last bolt for lower off hangers.

routes.name: No Crack Crooking
routes.description: Squeezed between Blunt Blade and BHOBC's crack. Uses Blunt Blade's lower off hangers.

routes.name: Thank Heaven For Little Girls
routes.description: The steep left-leaning arete opposite Guys Slab Climb past the last resting place of DAVE. Lower off the top bolt and scramble around to get the draw.

routes.name: Slick And Shine
routes.description: Offwidth left of FOREVER YOUNG.

routes.name: Why Me?
routes.description: The scoop just right of SAS. Pre-clip the first draw

routes.name: Forever Young
routes.description: The short north-facing wall 10m left of Wizards' arete. Careful not to stand on the bonsai growing on the wall slightly to the right!

routes.name: Overboard
routes.description: Right leaning diagonal break (rock #1). A one move 20.

routes.name: Wizards
routes.description: The left side of the dark arête, left of Guys Slab, with a large flat flake leaning against it. Lower off hangers on top. It is recommended to pre-clip the first bolt, for climber & belayers sake. Hopefully by the time you climb this route, the bolts have been replaced.

routes.name: Guy's Slab
routes.description: The steep and thin orange slab at the top of the approach chasm, just right of Wizards' arete. Use Wizard's lower off hangers.

routes.name: Skirting The Issue
routes.description: Something different. Straddle the Wizards and Satin Spider aretes till it gets too wide, clipping Satin Spider's bolts to that lower-off. Definitely a size or flexibilty-dependent grade.

routes.name: Dance Of The Satin Spider
routes.description: The arete opposite Wizards. The 2nd clip has great character. A challenging and thin 22.

routes.name: Fairy Fingers
routes.description: This route is opposite Wizards with U-bolts.

routes.name: Operasie Bullie Bief
routes.description: A shocking-looking off-width, awesome when laybacked. On the back of the pinnacle that hosts Fairy Fingers.

routes.name: Keelhaul The Rat
routes.description: Zigzags up the ever narrowing chimney.

routes.name: K1
routes.description: Starts 20m down the slope from SHIVER ME TIMBERS. Climb up just right of the arete to the ledge.

routes.name: K2
routes.description: Starts in the middle of the face just right of K1 (facing road).

routes.name: K4
routes.description: From the ledge, climb near the right arete to reach the base of the short crack.

routes.name: By Hook Or By Crook
routes.description: The crack in the middle of the west face. You can also use some bolts on NO CRACK CROOKING.

routes.name: Tinkerbell
routes.description: The crack towards the right of the west face.

routes.name: Pixie Dust
routes.description: Immediately right, around the corner from TINKERBELL. Climb grey rippled face. easier if you use the corner.

routes.name: Don’t Do Dishes Or Rap With Pigs
routes.description: The finger locking crack right of PD.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Marianne Pretorius

routes.name: Wishing For Fifty More Metres
routes.description: Coming 20m down the gulley, scramble up an arete low down, across the face to the base of a thin crack. Climb this to the top.
routes.fa_text: arianne Pretorius & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Spooks In The Closet
routes.description: Goes up the orange-grey slab 10 m left of the buttress.

routes.name: The Prow
routes.description: Goes up the left wall of the cave/chimney, slanting Lward to anchors

routes.name: Uriel's Machine
routes.description: The gap between the obvious buttress and the main wall is a wide chimney. Two thirds up the chimney is a large chockstone. Layback up a zig-zag crack directly beneath the chockstone. Variation: Climb the route as a chimney -somewhat easier.
routes.fa_text: E van der Poel & H Steinmann

routes.name: Toilet Brush
routes.description: Two meters to the right of URIEL'S MACHINE. Starts directly beneath a small overhang five meters up. Note: A toilet brush was used to clean both UM and TB and its name is no reflection on how one climbs the route.
routes.fa_text: E van der Poel & H Steinmann

routes.name: Yuduvudu
routes.description: Near the base of the descent gulley on the right is an obvious detached pillar. This route takes the leaning dark face.

routes.name: Weigh-less Crack
routes.description: On the N side of the buttress is a wide crack about 10m R of YUDUVUDU. Steep start.
routes.fa_text: Etienne van der Poel & Hildegard Steinmann Dec

routes.name: When We Were Young
routes.description: 4m R of the WEIGH-LESS CRACK.  Passes a small overlap at about 6m, then up the slab to anchors. Reachy

routes.name: Frequent Flyer
routes.description: 6m R of WEIGH-LESS CRACK is a line going through a bulge in the face (crux).
routes.fa_text: Etienne van der Poel & Hildegard Steinmann Sep

routes.name: Voyager
routes.description: 3m right of FF.
routes.fa_text: E van der Poel & H Steinmann Sep

routes.name: Journeyman
routes.description: Start 1m R of Voyager. Up R past a bush close to the arête which is followed to anchors. Direct finish to anchors will be harder – finish near BJ.

routes.name: Blokkies Joubert
routes.description: Around the corner is an appealing blunt blocky buttress has a series of blocky ledges.
routes.fa_text: Etienne van der Poel & H Steinmann Dec

routes.name: Tea For Two
routes.description: A face to the right and around the corner from BLOKKIES JOUBERT. The route follows a series of horizontal and vertical cracks.
routes.fa_text: Etienne van der Poel & Hildegard Steinmann Dec

routes.name: 2nd Anniversary
routes.description: 2m right of Tea for Two starting just to the left of the flaring chimney.
routes.fa_text: Etienne van der Poel & Hildegard Steinmann Dec

routes.name: I Drink Therefore I Am
routes.description: [X] Start as for 2nd Anniversary then move onto the steep column to the R, finishing just left of the overhang. Looks good but currently very loose near the top. Needs cleaning before safe.

routes.name: Nearly Headless Nick
routes.description: 8m right of the above is a steep east- facing yellow-grey slab. The climb starts off a big block.

routes.name: Any Other F@ckers
routes.description: A good trad line that should remain unbolted. Climbs the obvious crack system 5m lower and to the right of Nearly Headless Nick.
routes.fa_text: Stephen Mallory, Dean Gurney, Cara Fleisher, Stephanie Mallory, Richard Mallory

routes.name: Curse Of The Armadillo
routes.description: A few metres right of Nearly Headless Nick. Climb the cracks up the slab and exit left.

routes.name: Of Herbs And Stewed Rabbit
routes.description: Up the right arête of the flaky red wall, starting in a large crack left of the arête.. It needs a lot of gear, has some hollow rock and is included in this guide mainly because of the name!

routes.name: Mixer Mincer Shredder Liquidizer
routes.description: The bolt line up a prominent steep slab a few metres right of the aforementioned bowl. Starts off a big ledge. May your fingers have thick skin!

routes.name: Short Cut To Mushrooms
routes.description: Climb the crack right of MIXER MINCER SHREDDER LIQUIDIZER.

routes.name: Greatest Doctor In The Universe
routes.description: Start up FROZEN FLESH'S crack. Move up left to climb the face just right of the arete. Finish at the same lower-offs as STONE COLD.

routes.name: Frozen Flesh
routes.description: Follows the crackline right of the arete into a shallow corner. Climb the face straight above.

routes.name: Doa
routes.description: The fierce-looking crack. Harder for midgets.

routes.name: Blood Transfusion
routes.description: Start up DYING TO FLY. Move 2m left at half height to a vague seam. Climb this.

routes.name: Dying To Fly
routes.description: The first right leaning crack off the ledge, about 6m right of DOA. A bouldery move to gain the slab.

routes.name: Three Blind Mice
routes.description: The other right leaning crack -more technical but easier than DTF. Step right from the ledge -the first 5m are off-balance. Probably 19 if you work out the moves quickly.

routes.name: See How They Run
routes.description: This is the direct start to THREE BLIND MICE, follow the crack from ground level.

routes.name: The Carving Knife
routes.description: From the base of the THREE BLIND MICE crack, move diagonally right on the face to the 3rd bolt. Climb straight up, joining THREE BLIND MICE to the top.

routes.name: High Noon
routes.description: 4m right of the ledge edge. A bit reachy. There is a lot of climbing around the 4th bolt.

routes.name: Bolted Bones
routes.description: The beautiful fingercrack 4m left of the corner. Start off a little ledge.

routes.name: Recovery Room
routes.description: The jamcrack/layback in the corner. Finishes up the arête & face on the left wall.

routes.name: Bridget Goes To Casualty
routes.description: The short crack 3m right of RECOVERY ROOM'S corner.

routes.name: Fly By Day
routes.description: On face holds 1m left of FLY BY NIGHT; uses same recess in the upper reaches, and the same bolts throughout.

routes.name: Fly By Night
routes.description: Face move at left hand bolt line. Climb recess above.

routes.name: Bridget Flies Again
routes.description: Face move 2m right of FBN avoiding the corner. Uses BCA's bolts.

routes.name: Bridget Climbs Again
routes.description: Using the corner where needed and the same bolts.

routes.name: Bolder Problem
routes.description: The steep face on the boulder behind BRIDGET CLIMBS AGAIN.

routes.name: Learning To Fly
routes.description: Climb the steep face right and 7m around the corner from BOLDER PROBLEM. Expect slopes.

routes.name: Not-so-bold Problem
routes.description: Can be started either in the slot or from the upper level. A bouldery sequence past the 2nd bolt will get you to the mega summit.
routes.fa_text: Robert and Trish Breyer, Clive Curson, Don Poe

routes.name: Short And Sweet
routes.description: The climb in the middle.
routes.fa_text: Trish and Robert Breyer, Clive Curson, Don Poe

routes.name: Galahad
routes.description: Starts just R of the arête at the lower level. Climb up and somewhat L to S&S’s Ubolt anchors.
routes.fa_text: C Curson, T and R Breyer, D Poe

routes.name: Arthur
routes.description: This arête can be seen about 7m in front of you as you approach the wriggle hole on the path from ACRA B&B. Climb R of the arête to Ubolt anchors.
routes.fa_text: C Curson, D Poe, Robert and Trish Breyer

routes.name: Guinevere
routes.description: At the higher level 3m R of ARTHUR, climb past 3 hangers to chains

routes.name: Lancelot
routes.description: 2m R of Guenevere and 2m L of a hanging corner, climb to chains at the top of the slab.

routes.name: Braveheart
routes.description: Climb up to the hanging corner to clip the low chains.

routes.name: Boadicea
routes.description: Crimp the slab 2m R of the hanging corner.

routes.name: Hagar
routes.description: Climb the slab just L of the tree to high chains.

routes.name: Davy Crockett
routes.description: Start R of the tree L of the arête. Climb past 3 Ubolts and go R around the arête to Ubolt anchors.
routes.fa_text: Don Poe, R & T Breyer, C Curson

routes.name: Gus Se Nuwe Fluitjie
routes.description: Climb just R of the arête to anchors shared with DC.
routes.fa_text: Clive Curson, Don Poe, Trish and Robert Breyer

routes.name: Korporaal Klap ‘n Kokkerot
routes.description: 4m R of the arête, climb the face using a big hold 1.5m L of the 2nd Ubolt.
routes.fa_text: Don Poe, Robert & Trish Breyer, C Curson

routes.name: Korporaal Klap Die Krokodil
routes.description: Using the same bolts climb the face close to the bolts.
routes.fa_text: Clive Curson, Robert and Trish Breyer, Don Poe

routes.name: Inspekteur Bliksem Neer
routes.description: “Inspector takes a big fall”. Opened by one of the local Police officers.

routes.name: Les Trois Meufs
routes.description: "The three babes": To the right behind BOLDER PROBLEM is another block. Climb the crack.

routes.name: Pieter Stywe Sersant
routes.description: The face / arete right of the crack in the middle of the boulder

routes.name: The Crack
routes.description: The first route is at the left of the face just south of the fence. Using the bolts on the face to the right, climb the crack and finish left up the pillar to the long chains.

routes.name: Smoking Grass
routes.description: Climb the face just right of THE CRACK. A short traverse to the right may be needed halfway up the route.

routes.name: Milkman
routes.description: Climb the face just left of the arete.

routes.name: Gas
routes.description: Stay on the arete through overlap.

routes.name: Fluffy And Moo Cow
routes.description: Climb face between arete and tree.

routes.name: Khanyisile
routes.description: Fine balancy moves up the steep wall partway up the gulley.

routes.name: Cowlick
routes.description: Uses unusual holds up the pockmarked line left of the arete.

routes.name: Cowabunga
routes.description: Line of bolts through roof. Exit up crack.

routes.name: Cowboys
routes.description: Starts left of, and shares 2 bolts on STARGRAZER.

routes.name: Stargrazer
routes.description: Starts in crack with chockstone. Pull straight up from underneath the bulge.

routes.name: Gyppo-guts
routes.description: Starts at a hollow-topped stone. Follow crack to wide roof crack, using some cunning. Pull up to chains on the right.

routes.name: Imodium
routes.description: Climb 3 bolts on GYPPO-GUTS; traverse right; pull bulge.

routes.name: Sir Christopher's Crack
routes.description: The old trad line that now has bolts thanks to Chris.

routes.name: Abattoir
routes.description: [GPS: S25 38 59.0 E30 20 37.2] Cool extended boulder problem on the far right of the crag.

routes.name: Mampoer
routes.description: This climb is on the trail, 30 metres before the main crag is reached. Climbs the buttress just before a step leading up to the gulley.

routes.name: Queen Of The Night
routes.description: The same as POD, but deviate neither to right nor left.

routes.name: Prince Of Darkness
routes.description: On the smooth brown wall at the left of the crag. At Bolt#2 up a seam on the right till this becomes too hard. Back to the middle (bolt#3 hard to clip) then up using the crack on the left. Maybe a bit easier if you're tall.

routes.name: Lucifer Goes To The Gunks
routes.description: 10m left of the lunch spot. Pull the roof on wild holds!

routes.name: Merci My Brother
routes.description: A route with hangers just right of Lucifer and also sustained.
Takes the thin crackline a few meters left of the main cave, past some well jammed blocks through the overlap.

routes.name: Eat Your Heart Out
routes.description: 5 bolts as for 666. Step right and break through the overlap near the right end (3-4m left of the BLACK MAGIC seam). Reachy.

routes.name: Black Magic
routes.description: Clip 5 bolts up 666, traverse right to a beautiful seam through the headwall directly above the cave. Take 2-3 super long draws. It is quite possible to do the route on a 50m rope. Can be done as a 2 pitch mission.

routes.name: See What Happens
routes.description: This climb starts from a u-bolt and hanger placed just right of the start of the last pitch of BLACK MAGIC. One can first do BM to warm up on or climb in from the TTGTH traverse from the right.

routes.name: Don Pedro
routes.description: Clip first five bolts of THE PIT and move left, blast through the roof to the right of the BLACK MAGIC seam and up the open book corner. Take a couple of long slings.

routes.name: Open Project.
routes.description: The very steep bulge has several bolts in it and anchors and is open for anyone to try…..if you feel inspired

routes.name: Tried To Go To Heaven...
routes.description: A retro-bolted trad adventure. a) 17 (6D,A) Climb the PIT jamcrack just right of the cave to a stance. b) 20 (7D,A) Rail leftwards past the peapod to a stance. c) 21 (6D,A) Climb the BLACK MAGIC seam to the summit. Or just do it as one pitch with long slings and a 50m rope.

routes.name: The Pit
routes.description: The first pitch of TRIED TO GO TO HEAVEN. Climb the crack to lower-offs at a ledge. Don't blow the 3rd clip.

routes.name: Babies' Blood Gives Me Gas
routes.description: The open book. A bolted trad-like classic.

routes.name: Screaming Demons
routes.description: The blunt arete just right of BBGMG.

routes.name: Shout At The Devil
routes.description: Phenomenal climbing on the steep face 6m right of the BBGMG corner.

routes.name: Helter Skelter
routes.description: The thin looking face just left of the corner.

routes.name: Howling In Hell
routes.description: The left-facing corner and roof crack. More trad stuff.

routes.name: Howling In Hades
routes.description: The right hand variation after the roof. Fingery.

routes.name: Mad Cow
routes.description: Very height dependent. 1 move, 1 star!

routes.name: Devil's Concubine
routes.description: Starts 5m right of the HOWLING IN HADES corner. Good warm up route.

routes.name: Devil's Disciple
routes.description: Starts just right of DEVIL'S CONCUBINE up a vague corner. Pull the overlap and continue up the slab above to chains.

routes.name: Route Of All Evil
routes.description: This climbs the root-infested gulley 10m to the right of DD. Shares chains with DEVIL'S DISCIPLE. Expect to get your ropes damp in the wet season.

routes.name: A La Carte
routes.description: Starts up God of Small things then moves left then up on very small holds. Opened at 30! Alternative start bolted by A. Pedley, won’t change the grade and nicer, being independent and direct.  Needs a 2nd ascent.

routes.name: God Of Small Things
routes.description: Takes the line up the middle of the face on small holds. Superbly technical.

routes.name: Devil In A Cauldron
routes.description: A fantastic line. Takes the right hand edge of the eye-catching face.

routes.name: Bolts From Hell
routes.description: 45m along from the last routes of the Coven. About 2m left of the arete on the middle tower. Sort of runout at the crux.

routes.name: Salem
routes.description: Starts in the corner right of the arete. After clipping the 2nd bolt, rail left just around the corner. Up to lower-offs.

routes.name: Possessed
routes.description: Starts 2m up the gulley. Climb to lower-offs.

routes.name: Bad Omen
routes.description: Climb 2m right of the last route to the same lower-offs.

routes.name: Hot Stuff
routes.description: Follow path 15m down. Climb the South-East face of the North Tower.

routes.name: The Exorcist
routes.description: Climbs the fine line on the Northern face of the North Tower.

routes.name: Tree Love
routes.description: More dendrophilia! From the East entrance, 15m left of the tunnel. Climb the tangle of overhanging roots to a stance. Up corner for 2m then right and up the cracks, exit on slab to right.
routes.fa_text: M Loewe, Mike Cartwright & F Botha

routes.name: Retrograd Rat And The Yeoville Diva
routes.description: Climb the tangle of overhanging roots to a stance 5m right of TREE LOVE's rock start. Climb the corner through a roof, 3m right of the prow. Exits up left groove/ chimney.

routes.name: Fantasy Fondue Forfeit
routes.description: [GPS: S25 38 10.5 E30 20 42.3]  At the west entrance, 8m right of an old fence take the right hand crack till some loose blocks. Pull up and left through a roof, traverse 2m and exit up an easy crack.

routes.name: Just Before Breakfast
routes.description: On the far left of the crag, past the Coming Of Pride pinnacle there is an obvious in a gully crack (on the right when looking down the gully).
routes.fa_text: Volker Schweinbenz & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Eastsoloing
routes.description: Climb the arete on the opposite side of the pinnacle to Coming Of Pride.

routes.name: South Corner
routes.description: Climb the recess of the right of the pillar on the river side of the pinnacle.

routes.name: Styling
routes.description: Climb the arete left of Coming Of Pride.

routes.name: Coming Of Pride
routes.description: Climb the crack system up the front of the pinnacle. (The waterfall lurks behind you while climbing).

routes.name: Out Of Germany
routes.description: The amazing yellowish arête to the right of Coming Of Pride, with the big german-style (spaced!) ring bolts. You may need friends #.5, #2.5 at the bottom. Use some lower-offs on LB.

routes.name: Little Bitch
routes.description: Climb the wall of the pinnacle, to the right of the Out Of Germany arête. Starts in a finger crack then up the left trending seam.

routes.name: Funky Fruit
routes.description: On the main face opposite Out of Germany. Start just left of the tree roots on the obvious line going slightly to the right. At the top of the tree go one move to the left and then follow the obvious line again. Wach out for the huge loose boulder on your right.

routes.name: Two For Tree
routes.description: Climb a finger crack in the recess below a massif creeper fig tree. Climb over some roots heading through the flaring chimney to finish slightly up and right high up.
routes.fa_text: Chris Jansen & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: You Can Take Your Dog To The Water...
routes.description: Start left around the corner and up the recess from THE WIZARD OF OZ. Step right avoiding a tree and into the crack. Climb this onto the arete halfway up. Then traverse left into the obvious crack and up.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Claire Keeton

routes.name: Wizard Of Oz
routes.description: [ GPS: S25 38 11.8 E30 20 47.5] Starts about 30m right of little bitch at a face just right of an obvious recess. Pitch 1. 11 ** Climb tree for 5m, step over to face. Pitch 2. 16 **** Move through overlap up from ledge and up a crack. Then straight up to an exposed scramble left on a ledge.
routes.fa_text: Clive Curson, Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Thulani Mazibuko

routes.name: The Gutter
routes.description: Start as for NN, but climb the face. Pitch 1. 15 *** From thin moves with tricky protection straight up the face to the ledge. Pitch 2. 15 ** From the far left end of the ledge, climb up traversing diagonally back towards a crack after 3m. Then straight up to an exposed scramble left on a ledge.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Thulani Mazibuko

routes.name: Creep It 'n Reap It
routes.description: Start just right from THE GUTTER in a corner. Climb this into a roof then step out left (crux) and then easy up to a (belay) ledge. From ledge, traverse right to the arete and follow to top through the creeper fig.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Johann Venter

routes.name: Et Tu Ceasar
routes.description: A rippled face with a chimney crack just right of it is found. Climb the face to a rail. Traverse right into the chimney onto a ledge. Climb straight up close to the right edge of the ledge on powerful moves. Continue through the overlap to a ledge then head for the tallest headwall of the crag. The route is 45m long and can be done in 2 pitches.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Claire Keeton

routes.name: Boa Rodeo
routes.description: The left crack on the obvious steep leaning white streaked wall on the far right of the crag. Wow! Seeps in the summer. Go very early on a winters day or during a dry spell at other times.

routes.name: Mlungu Goes To School
routes.description: Starts from the big block right of Boa Rodeo. One bolt protects the bottom crux followed by some technical, run out endurance sections.

routes.name: Scrabble
routes.description: Takes the corner right of the steep cracks on the obvious overhanging wall. Climb left towards anchors on the headwall.

routes.name: Khamikazi Leila
routes.description: Starts in a left facing corner below the slanting crack 10m right of SCRABBLE. Climb left past tree roots around a corner to the base of the crack. Follow the crack to the summit.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Claire Keeton

routes.name: In My Place
routes.description: Unbelievable. 30m right of SCRABBLE. Climb the crack on the steep wall 5m left of an arete till under the roof. Step out left then back onto the headwall keeping right of the tree. Possible to make a stance here, or continue on easier ground to the top.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg, Johann Olivier & Skapie van Niekerk

routes.name: Thornication
routes.description: Start 8 right of IN MY PLACE in a corner. Climb the corner then pull through a small roof on good holds, move right to the arete and climb to top. Abseil off thorn tree which is located about 5m below the top.

routes.name: Urisk The Rustic Brownie
routes.description: An incredible position, beside the waterfall. This is the first line to the right when looking at the waterfall. Abseil to a bolted stance 20m down and climb back out. A 60m rope is needed to escape from the stance if you do get stuck.

routes.name: Before The Inner Child
routes.description: The face left of the arete.

routes.name: Sorcery
routes.description: Awesome line -famous for the photo opportunity with the waterfall in the background. Starting just left of the arete, climb it. Take care, protection is sparse!

routes.name: Satan's Temple
routes.description: Starts just right of the arete from a great ledge. Involves a long dyno and a very fingery headwall. An awesome climb in an awesome place.

routes.name: Unlimited Power
routes.description: Starts from the chains on the left of the ledge. Power moves take you steeply left and up the headwall. Was opened at 27.

routes.name: Screaming Blue Messiah
routes.description: Trad line -no bolts. From the chains at the left edge of the ledge, head slightly right into the obvious break. Keep going.

routes.name: Something Esoteric
routes.description: The next crack right of SBM, about 4m right of the first corner. Quite runout but wonderful. Zap up to the chains. It is possible to access by rapping in from the tree on top.

routes.name: Jitterbug Perfume
routes.description: The corner. The 2 existing bolts are not well placed (this & the last 2 routes will hopefully be retrobolted one day soon). Top out just right of the crack.

routes.name: A Mixture Of Frailties
routes.description: Start at chains on the ledge right of the corner. Climb up easy-ish ground heading a bit left. Then it gets harder…

routes.name: You Too Brutus
routes.description: From the chains climb up and thinly right. Go through the overlaps to the chains. RB in 2008.

routes.name: Madiba Magic
routes.description: Starts 5m right from the base of the normal descent gully. In character with the rest of the awesomeness of this crag.

routes.name: The Bibiche Line
routes.description: Climbs left of SCID.

routes.name: Sport Climbing Is Dead
routes.description: An obvious crack 20 m right of the WB gully. The route is about 35m long.

routes.name: Paint It Black
routes.description: Tricky technical climb.

routes.name: Electric Avenue -pitch 1
routes.description: About 40m right of SCID. A few steepish moves up to the belay ledge and the start of the next pitch. FA: Glenn Harrison

routes.name: Electric Avenue-pitch 2
routes.description: Continue from the ledge with rap anchors onto the top section or break it into 2 pitches.

routes.name: Unplugged Avenue
routes.description: Climb the thin crack to the right of ELECTRIC AVENUE to the ledge at the end of EA's first pitch.
routes.fa_text: Herman van Zyl, Karen Stegmann & Hendrik Neethling

routes.name: Endless Summer
routes.description: Face climbing can’t get any better than this, long and technical. Over 30 metres, tie a knot in the end!

routes.name: Superfly
routes.description: The similarly enjoyable but slightly harder journey just right of ES. Over 30 metres, tie a knot in the end!.

routes.name: Good Times
routes.description: Technical face climbing with a thin crux. This climb is 30+m long, be prepared to top out or bring an extra rope.

routes.name: Fudge Beats Burfee
routes.description: Diagonally leftwards up to the obvious knee bar in the block under the overlap. Pull over this rightwards then easy to finish.

routes.name: Monkey Puzzle
routes.description: Climb straight up from the third bolt of FUDGE BEATS BURFEE through a reachy roof section. Harder for short people. Tie a knot in the end of your rope!

routes.name: As The World Disappears
routes.description: Up the face then leftward through the overlap to a headwall crack that keeps on coming. 30+m route, steep and sustained with great photo opportunities.

routes.name: Trippin' On Life
routes.description: The long face just left of CJ.

routes.name: Caffeine Jitters
routes.description: Was a trad climb, rebolted recently. Scramble up the bushy slab just right of 'ATWD' and head for the two protruding trees, then climb the awesome fist sized crack to the top. The climb can be done in a single pitch.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Chris Jansen

routes.name: Amakrokokroko
routes.description: Hack up the bushy slope just right of CAFFEINE JITTERS to the obvious right facing corner leading up to the fun crack system.

routes.name: To Crack Or Not To Crack
routes.description: Pitch 1 20*** 20m Start on the corner below the obvious layback crack left of WHO’S YOUR DADDY. Climb out underneath the undercut flake using RP's or huge cams and up to the obvious ledge. 2. Pitch 15*** 12m Continue straight to the top. Can be done in a single pitch.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Chris Jansen

routes.name: Me
routes.description: Start as for WYD, then head straight up onto hangers

routes.name: Who's Your Daddy?
routes.description: A nice long warm-up!? One of best 19’s in Boven.

routes.name: The Three Mosquitos
routes.description: Just left of the big corner. A little crack, face and roof climbing. You can top out on this route and hike down along the trail back West towards the mouth of the tunnel. So end your day with this line to avoid the scrambles!

routes.name: Chakalaka
routes.description: Break out right after the third bolt of THE THREE MOSQUITOES.

routes.name: Unterwegs Nach Haus
routes.description: Just right of the arete, 30+m long. so slightly run out!!

routes.name: Wish You Were Here
routes.description: Share the first couple of bolts with UH, then out right. Ever so slightly run out!!

routes.name: Nature Of Being
routes.description: Ever so slightly run out!!! Take a #0 and #0.5 Friend plus a #1 rock for in case you need it.

routes.name: Transmutation
routes.description: About 50m left of Heck, Tick. The route follows the crack that breaks the large red face and through a roof at 25m. Tend right into the recess just above and step out to the top.
routes.fa_text: G Janse van Rensburg & M Seuring

routes.name: Along For The Ride
routes.description: Start at large flaring offwidth crack. Climb the crack till it ends and move left to a tree stance. Step out left and climb crack till roof and rail left 2 meters. Pull through break and up headwall. Take small gear.
routes.fa_text: Alard Hüfner, Mark Seuring & Douard le Roux

routes.name: Heck, Tick
routes.description: Starts below on an obvious corner capped by large roofs 15m above. Climb the corner and bypass the roofs on the left, then straight up the head wall.
routes.fa_text: Mark Seuring & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Static Scampering
routes.description: Climb the corner 2m left of DFADS; bypass overhang on left and scamper up slab through overlap to top.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Mark Seuring

routes.name: Dust From A Distant Sun
routes.description: Starts 15m left of FTL. Climb short overhanging crack. Step 1m right and pull through roof. Climb slab tending slightly left to good abseil tree. (Intricate gear placements).
routes.fa_text: Mark Seuring & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Follow The Light
routes.description: Coming from the East End, 20m from the tunnel mouth, climb the obvious roof crack by the big tree. From the halfway ledge climb the off-width to the top.
routes.fa_text: Mark Seuring & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Lost Track
routes.description: From the WB graffiti, climb the left hand line to chains. Apart from the photo potential, this route is not as good as it looks.

routes.name: Boer Skiet Dief Dood
routes.description: Clip the first bolt on LT, then traverse up to the right hand line. Translation : “Farmer shoots thief dead.” This was a newspaper headline that day!

routes.name: Train Massacre
routes.description: [ GPS: S25 38 00.1 E30 20 57.0]  From the 461m long train tunnel, walk up 10m to find the first bolt.

routes.name: Boipatong
routes.description: 6m right of the fence (right of TM). Up to a break, up face, out left onto a slab, out right (#1 rock behind flake) up to roof, traverse right and up to a ledge. Ab off tree 15m right.

routes.name: Easy Street
routes.description: Start from the cave/recess and climb the left break on the prominent wall.
routes.fa_text: G Laurens, Dave Walden & R van Wyk

routes.name: Flies On The Back Of A Cow
routes.description: [ GPS: S25 38 25.9 E30 21 05.3] Start a few metres right of EASY STREET and climb the right break on the prominent wall.
routes.fa_text: G Laurens, Dave Walden & R van Wyk

routes.name: Moon Dreamer
routes.description: On the next wall to the right. Climb the line just right of the recess finishing up the left leaning break.

routes.name: Sloth On The Loose
routes.description: The object is the nice looking headwall up on the right. Start a few metres right of MOON DREAMER and climb up to the headwall. Follow the neat line to the top.

routes.name: Topless Skateboard Nun
routes.description: About 50m left of AFRICAN ODYSSEY, are some big roofs halfway up the crag. Start up the obvious crack below these and traverse left on the ledge until you are below the left hand end of the roof. Climb the crack to the roof. Pull through the cubby hole onto the slab (crux needs friend #and follow the crack to the top.

routes.name: Under A Choking Sun
routes.description: 4m right of TSN. Up orange face moving right to ledges and up a big shallow corner (crux) to grassy ledge. Finish up crack on right. Rather gearless!

routes.name: African Odyssey
routes.description: Starting towards the left, follow the bolts into the centre of the face, then up a crack to finish. Take your thinnest fingers.

routes.name: Little Man's Complex
routes.description: Climb the corner, moving left onto the slab and up to the coldshuts.

routes.name: Rachel And Rebecca
routes.description: The short but good-looking corner left of the arete project.
routes.fa_text: C Curson, B Marcus & L Waldman

routes.name: Poes In Boots
routes.description: Climb the middle of the wall 2.5m right of the an open project. 30m right of AFRICAN ODYSSEY. The 3rd clip is tricky, a gripper, clipper, whipper -ground fall. Use the chains on the arete.

routes.name: Night Of The Crash Test Dummies
routes.description: The biggest crack line on the left. Traverse slightly right at the top to exit.

routes.name: The Colour Purple
routes.description: On the west-facing wall to the right are 3 cracks. The left one goes at about 15. The seam in the middle is this one. Vertical but tricky -may be 22 for tall dudes.

routes.name: Eccentrica Gallumbitz
routes.description: The wider crack just to the right.

routes.name: Day Of Decimation
routes.description: in a crazy wild place. The arete right of the 3 cracks. Permission has been granted for retro-bolting!

routes.name: Black Planet
routes.description: Around the arete to the right of the 3 cracks are 2 subsiduary corners. The right hand one is not too pleasant (grade -22/23). This route is the left one.

routes.name: Dark Star
routes.description: pitch 20 Climb the right corner. Exiting left. Pitch 23 Optional pitch but not recommended. Move back right to the corner.

routes.name: Mannenburg
routes.description: Start 4m right of the corner, climb the short face to below the roof, turn this and climb the crack to the top.

routes.name: White Arses
routes.description: Behind the approach boulders 10m left of the Happy Acres Block. This is the line of ring bolts to the left of the obvious right-slanting crack.

routes.name: Slanting Crack
routes.description: Climb the rightward slanting crack.

routes.name: The Lightness Of Being
routes.description: The line of ring bolts to the right of the crack.

routes.name: Kimosabe The Music's Starting
routes.description: A finger crack up the on-balance wall, opposite the cave. Starts just right of the short, obvious layback crack.

routes.name: Roger Strikes Back
routes.description: Starts 6m left of the offwidth, DBB just left of HAPPY ACRES CAVE. Go thinly up a seam, then up right until able to go up and back leftwards to lower offs near the arete.

routes.name: Death By Banda
routes.description: Climb the obvious off-width crack as one enters the Happy Acres Cave. A fighting pitch of considerable merit and suitable for the whole family. Take along 4 friends in the range #3.5 to #4.

routes.name: The Immaculate Misconception
routes.description: Climb the crack line inside the cave.

routes.name: Champion Barbed-wire Hurdler
routes.description: Located in the 'room' behind Happy Acres Boulder. Start below the large open book on the boulder. Climb past a roof to a ledge at 5m. Traverse 2m left and up the diagonal crack, to exit past hollow flakes.

routes.name: Thompson & Thompson
routes.description: Situated on the Happy Acres Boulder, opposite DEATH BY BANDA

routes.name: Tramplepath
routes.description: Another line of bolts, on the left of the Happy Acre Boulder.

routes.name: Whistle Stop
routes.description: On railway side of boulder. Start in a small corner 5m right of the edge of the boulder, below the obvious broad crack line. Climb the crack.

routes.name: Minnie Mouse’s Menopause
routes.description: On the south face of the boulder. The slab with two bolts right of the big chimney crack. Take along a #2 friend.

routes.name: Fred's Cornflake Collection
routes.description: Climb the big flake line right of MMM.

routes.name: Kill The Wabbit
routes.description: Climb the on-balance wall right of FCC. Move right towards the arete to the broken crack half way up, then straight up.

routes.name: The Bart Man
routes.description: Situated on the main wall on the south side of the Happy Acres Boulder. The obvious flake line left of the chimney.

routes.name: It's No Bulldog
routes.description: The obvious thin crack line left of SUTBID.

routes.name: Something Under The Bed Is Drooling
routes.description: The short crack behind the pinnacle. Seam on left, long crack on right.

routes.name: Dopey Does De Aar
routes.description: Still no sign of Dopey. Somewhere out there does he lurk.

routes.name: Pink Panther Se Pillar
routes.description: The climb follows the overhanging crack up the back of the pillar, opposite SUTBID.
routes.fa_text: G Laurens & F van der Linder

routes.name: Palm It Off
routes.description: Right of the BART MAN flake is a short pillar against the face. Next to this you may find this climb.

routes.name: Back Stoep Exposé
routes.description: Pitch 1: 20m 19 Start 20m left of TWO ARD through a break in the overlap. Climb right under the roofs to the obvious step over to an exposed stance. Pitch 2: 18m 18 Straight up the face onto the coolest protected stance with a view of the Elands valley. Rap to the ground with 2 x 50m ropes, or in two abseils.
routes.fa_text: Glenn Harrison, Gustav Janse van Rensburg, Mark Seuring & Marianne Pretorius

routes.name: Two Ard
routes.description: Pitch 1: 30m 21 Start at the end of the walk-in path. Climb straight up to a cubby-hole stance. Pitch 2: 20m 22 Break right up the roofs.

routes.name: Ceasars Bowl
routes.description: This route, the first on the crag, follows a line up the middle of the main face. Pitch 1. 17 ** 35m. Start on the face 10m left of the obvious, shallow lunch cave. Climb up tending right into a recess till a large ledge below an overhanging face. Pitch 2. 23 *** 20m. Start at back left corner of ledge. Climbs strenuous corner crack for 6m the traverse right for 3m on good holds and exposure. Fire straight up to a ledge from where one can belay and walk off. A: Alard Hüfner & Gustav Janse van Rensburg 200
routes.fa_text: Alard Hüfner & Gustav Janse van Rensburg

routes.name: Rasta And Basta
routes.description: Two pitches with slightly loose rock, probably better now if its had traffic.

routes.name: Allo Aloe
routes.description: This route climbs the obvious right facing break that forms a corner in the middle of the face. The opening party climbed it in two pitches of 25 metres each. From the top, walk 15m right to a good abseil tree. Abseil to ledge and another good tree will bring you back to the ground.
routes.fa_text: Gustav Janse van Rensburg & Chris Jansen
